boardgame.name: Dead On Arrival
boardgame.description:
From p8ublisher blurb:

The characters awake in a deserted hospital weeks after the zombie outbreak to find a world ravaged by the dead...

Dead On Arrival is the pilot episode of The Living Dead Campaign. This non-traditional Savage Worlds Plot Point Campaign for Dead End takes your Novice survivor characters through the first year of the zombie apocalypse with a recurring series of monthly episodes that tell the gripping tale of fear and survival in a world claimed by the dead.

boardgame.name: Phantom Earth War vol. 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

They are the heroes sucked into a war with Lord ShadArk. Meet the men and women, human and alien that are the last hope for the humans trapped on the Phantom Earth. Are they enough?

This module includes stats for heroes of the Phantom Earth War along with bases and locations key to the Phantom Earth War Campaign.

boardgame.name: Phantom Earth War vol. 3
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The war is underway! Can the heroes trapped on the Phantom Earth escape? Will allies from the stars help or hinder a victory against the demon horde?

This campaign module includes all primary and secondary story arc missions for game masters. Great for a series of one shots or an ongoing campaign.

Includes new characters and new threats.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Turning Points – Tyrfing
boardgame.description:
Rumors of valuable Star League hardware left over from the war against Stefan the Usurper bring treasure hunters to the Free Worlds League world of Tyrfing in the midst of the First Succession War. These trespassers hailed from the Capellan Confederation and Lyran Commonwealth. The Free Worlders sent reinforcements, only for the rumors to spread to the other Successor States. Soon, forces from the Federated Suns and Draconis Combine joined those already on Tyrfing. The Five-Way War for the fabled treasure of Tyrfing had begun!

Turning Points: Tyrfing uses Chaos Campaign rules to give players the option of fighting individual battles or following a campaign arc, and even includes special rules for randomizing allies and enemies and battling within the unique terrain of the Great Crystal Valley. Included are a detailed map of the world of Tyrfing, full details of the forces involved in the Trial, and scenario tracks recreating the battles on Tyrfing. The only limits are the players’ imaginations!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Anderian Adventures: The Ebony Box
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first in a series of adventured for Chivalry & Sorcery 5th Edition, set in the Fantasy Kingdom of Anderia. The game is set in the isolated Town of Gengorge where things are about to get unreal.

The game is for a group of adventurers who are just starting out. 1st - 3rd Level. As the series progresses the characters will have the chance to make powerful allies and more than a few enemies too. Magick and ancient powers will come into play as the group attempt to thwart the plot of a powerful mastermind bent on bringing back something that should never
have existed.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Operational Turning Points – Hanseatic Crusade
boardgame.description:
ensions simmered between the Hanseatic League and the new Scorpion Empire for decades before the Hansa lit the spark that led to war. The Khan of Clan Goliath Scorpion knew a simple punitive expedition would be a waste of resources. This would not be a war of reprisal. It would be an all-out crusade for control of Hansa territory. Superior Clan technology pitted against superior numbers of Hansa troops. In such a war, can there truly be a victor? Would two nations be shattered in the conflict, or would a single, new power rise from the ruins?

Operational Turning Points: Hanseatic Crusade opens up the battle for players to join in the fight using the successful Turning Points PDF-exclusive format. This campaign series uses the Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual Missions and Touchpoints, following a campaign arc, and inserting it into their own campaigns. This PDF includes detailed information on several of the worlds affected by the Scorpion Empire assault, a rundown of the forces involved in the conflict, an overview of the historical campaign, and several tools and tracks that players can use to run characters and battles from this time period. Only the players’ imaginations are the limits.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Reedwater Campaign & Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

We Paint the Scenery. So you can tell the Story!

REEDWATER

Welcome to the early 13th Century and the challenges that come with living in the the Holy Roman Empire under civil war. This book contains details of the area around the Arcane Guild of Reedwater, it's magical Island and the creatures, wizards and fey that live there. As well as the ordinary townsfolk of Ingolstadt, Donau and Egwell. The book includes a cunning town based adventure to challenge the players.

Non Core usable with any version of Fate, with 145 pages containing lots of monsters, NPC's, magical items and story hooks designed to be use with any FATE implementation. Would also work well as a background source book for C&S or Ars Magica type of game.

boardgame.name: Reedwater Adventure No. 1: Unwanted Wizards
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Characters are from the Arcane Guild of Reedwater. A guild of arcane lore set in the 13th Century of the Holy Roman Empire, under civil war. They are tasked with finding out what is going on in the city of Ingosltadt. Strange occurances have been reported and it looks like a wizards is operating there. Is he a memeber of the order? if so, then he must be punished for working out in the open. Is he a new wizard? in which case he must be made to swear the oath the Arcane Brotherhood. Either way the characters must tread carefully, be sure not to reveal their powers and break the code.

38 pages with lots of monsters and NPC's as well as background to add to the Reedwater Campaign.

boardgame.name: Reedwater Adventure No. 2: Evil in Munich
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the early 13th Century and the challenges that come with living in the Holy Roman Empire under civil war. This book contains details of the ordinary townsfolk of Ingolstadt, as well as the two thieves guilds that vie for power in the streets, each with it’s own views on how to hold the reigns of power.

The game is set in the spring of the Year 1200 and located in the area of the Holy Roman Empire, around the important city of Ingolstadt. The Empire has seen the death of a great leader in the person of Henry VI and he leaves behind a young son Frederick; too young to rule as Emperor. Philip of Swabia and Otto of Brunswick vie for the seat as Holy Roman Emperor casting the whole land into a civil war.

Philip has the support of the majority of the nobles in the south and has used this to crown himself king of Germany; however, without the support of the church he can not become Emperor. Otto has the support of the church but not the support of the powerful Dukes and Barons. Both have large armies that continually skirmish and siege throughout the Lands of the Holy Roman Empire.

The players can play wizards or wizard and their company who have been sent on a mission to ascertain what is going on in the city, wizards of the Arcane brotherhood have been killed in the most gruesome fashion and the local wizards of the chapter house of Drondenberg are claiming they want to declare war. The characters must sort out the mystery of the deaths and make tough political desciisons.

40 pages with monsters and NPC's as well as background to add to the Reedwater Campaign.

boardgame.name: Reedwater Adventure No. 3: The Willow Maiden & The Mistletoe King
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The people of the 13th century were living in an agricultural society, they relied on vast quantities of grain. To get their grain they had to be in tune with the season, ploughing, planting, growing, harvest all relied on the knowledge of the seasons.

They believed that the seasons were controlled by forces, some thought that the winds and the sun were gods, who slept or woke - became loving or angry with the change of the seasons. There is also a fey version of this story regarding the mating of the Willow Maiden and the Mistletoe King.

The adventure asks the question, what would happen if the king never finds the Willow Maiden? What would happen if he were to be accosted and never came to settle? Then, winter would never come, it would be forever autumn.

After the ploughing the winter frost needs to break up the ground, release the nutrients. The animals would never get to spring and mate, fish would die in the lakes and rivers, the weather would turn the paths and tracks to deep mud. In short the kingdom would be in chaos.

boardgame.name: The Slave Lords Den
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Science fiction short adventure using fate. Works best with Stablazer Advenutres.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Turning Points – Helm
boardgame.description:
The Gray Death Legion: Mercenaries betrayed by their employer and betrayed from within. Both the Mariks and ComStar oppose them. Can Grayson Carlyle lead his command out of the trap that has ensnared them? Only quick, decisive action and determination will see them survive overwhelming odds.

Helm: A world of glaciers, tundra, rock-filled deserts, barren seas, and an ancient Star League secret. That secret could destroy the Legion and move humanity another step closer toward darkness. Or one step closer toward salvation. Helm and humanity’s future lay in the grasp of an outlawed mercenary unit.

Turning Points: Helm uses Chaos Campaign rules to give players the option of fighting individual battles or to follow a campaign arc. Included are a detailed map of the world of Helm, a rundown of the forces involved, and scenario tracks recreating the battles on Helm.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Horror in Weizenville
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A dark, deadly 5e horror adventure suitable for 4-6 characters of 5th level.

From the mind of game designer and voice actor Jerry Gee, discover the dark secrets in the seemingly pleasant festival village of Weizenville. Visitors who have left the town have reported a slew of disappearances. Citizens complain of hauntings within their homes, and the local lord has even sent out a request to exorcise the malignant spirits from his mansion. Investigators should tred lightly however, as they may discover not all of those in Weizenville are as friendly as they first appear.

The characters can choose to unveil the truth about the missing villagers and the village's prosperity, or simply hack n’ slash every obstacle until the village is at peace.

Explore the village of Weizenville, a pleasant festival village with dark secrets
Meet the villagers, some of who are far more terrible than they appear
Terrify your players with 5 all-new horrifying monsters
Ramp up the tension with optional madness rules
Bring your game to VTT wtih Roll20 optimized maps

boardgame.name: The Silver Veil of Carnola
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The new owner of an old abandoned theater has tasked the players with making sure that it is safe so that he can send his workers in to renovate it. There is just one problem though: The theater doesn’t have a rat infestation problem. Rather, it seems to be haunted by a very famous singer, as well as many of its former workers and attendants…

boardgame.name: Young Wizards Smart Savings
boardgame.description:
In an affluent society, it is more important than ever to instill good financial habits in our children. Why not start with Young Wizards Smart Savings, a collaborative game designed by AXA Hong Kong and the social enterprise People on Board? We encourage parents to join children in the game and help them grasp basic wealth management concepts like saving and spending wisely in a fun interactive setting, while inculcating positive values like civic consciousness and the importance of sharing.

On their turn, each player draws three cards from the draw pile. After resolving any charity or vice cards, the player then chooses whether to save or spend. If a player chooses "save", they put any coin cards in their wallet for use on a future turn. If they save three coins in one turn, they get to advance one space as a bonus. If a player chooses "spend", they pay the price and move the number of spaces indicated on the item card. Some item cards also have ongoing special effects.

After each player has taken a turn, the spinner is spun and all players must take the action indicated by the spinner.

The first player to reach the goal at the end of the board is the winner. That player has mastered the importance of saving and spending wisely.

boardgame.name: Path of the Daemoniacal
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Barbarian who takes this path embodies a hellish flame, drawn from Phlegethos itself. This fire is controlled by their rage, and can be manifested as weapons the Barbarian can wield. As they progress, they can intensify this hellfireto the point of even burning those born of flame. This Primal Path can be taken when the Barbarian reaches 3rd level.

boardgame.name: Fane of Good
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

This instalment is designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the noble's manor houses in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Spooky: Spider Worshippers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

ARACHNID DEVOTION

To those who worship the queen spiders, a poisonous reward awaits. Magic users, like the Spider Sorcerer and Warlock of the Spider, pledge fealty to her and in exchange they can assume the form of their master or summon legions of arachnid defenders in times of need - the greatest of which is the bizarre Tentacle Monster. Those with no arcane talent can still become faithful Servants of the Spider or in death, killed by the poison of tiny Spider Demons of their queen, they can become Poisonous Farting Zombies.

A brief monster compendium to 5th Edition Dungeons & Dragons.

boardgame.name: Trial by Fire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Trial by Fire is a Fifth Edition adventure for 3 to 7 characters, optimized for a party of 4 characters of 1st level.

The postal guild received a package destined for an abandoned dwarven tower. Oddly, instructions for the delivery request the adventurers by name.

There are watchtowers, beacons of light, throughout the underearth around the dwarven city of Eth Aldur. They offer a reprieve from the dangers that lurk in the dark and provide an emergency call system for the disparate towns and villages that have grown in the winding caves. Sometimes, as populations shift, these watchtowers fall out of use. One such tower is now inhabited by a drow oracle.

Talice Rhomduil
Talice Rhomduil is a drow woman (oracle) that lives in an abandoned dwarven watchtower. She has quietly maintained and operated the tower through the decades — the local dwarves, which have never seen anybody come or go in their lifetimes, believe a ghost is responsible and give the tower a wide berth even as they are grateful for the fire that burns at its peak. Talice has a gift of foresight and occasionally uses it to influence events in her vicinity.

Months prior to this adventure, Talice foresaw a group of dwarves taking refuge in her tower from an undead blackfire drake, which eventually batters down the tower’s entrance and kills both the dwarves and Talice. Talice used information from her other visions to piece together a way for the dwarves and herself to avoid an untimely death; a package addressed to herself, delivered by the characters, who will conveniently arrive at her tower as the drake is attacking and dispatch the threat.

boardgame.name: Fey Plague in the Underdark
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the secret town of driftwood, an eclectic mix of underdark denizens have lived peacefully – until recently when throngs of fey zombies have descended upon them. The residents believe they are coming from a strange and dangerous temple deep within a giant mushroom forest. Can the party uncover the temple’s secrets and stop the Fey Plague from consuming Driftwood? Featuring art from Pawel Parol, Shane Collins, Dean Spencer, Daniel Comerci, and Rick Hershey.

15 Page 5e Adventure for a 5th level party
2 Detailed NPCs with artwork and VTT Tokens
9 Battlemaps, each with 2 variations (grid and no grid)
Random events tables to help guide an underdark hexcrawl
Four new Monsters including fey zombies and the fungad.
Loaded with full-color artwork
23 Hexplorer Map Tiles to create a regional area for hex-crawl campaigns
Plug-and-play design to make dropping the adventure into your campaign as easy as possible with minimal prep

boardgame.name: An Average Small Auditorium
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to The Copeland Performing Arts Center. This center seats over 150 people and serves as a great free-standing venue for a college theater arts program, community theater or regional peforming arts center. The venue has two consession and ticketing areas, large stage, rehersal space, private dressing areas and more. In addition a front view of the building is provided that you can use to help players visualize the location.

This floorplan is presented in both an 8 1/2"x11" format for folks who want an overview and also in 36”x48” where one inch=5 feet. Layers are also included that allow you to turn on and off hexes, squares, labels, furniture and even walls. The floor plans are presented on white sheets for ease of printing.

boardgame.name: Rapture: Atlantis Starter Box
boardgame.description:
Long before the Sumerians, Elamites and Egyptians, the Athlanteans, alongside the people of the Icnun, developed the earlyhigh culture on Earth. Inhabiting a land mass in today's Aegean Sea, the civilization of Atlantis received technologyfrom the Angels in 3500 BC as part of the initiation into the role of Wardens, initially on a trial basis. Instead of completing the Angel's tasks, hovever, the Atlanteans pursued their own agenda and began to research the Angels and the civilization of the gods. In 3114 BC, Atlantis was destroyed by the Angels and any survivors went to hiding in Egypt.
After Caesar's invasion, the people of Atlantis decided to seel refuge in the sea where they could find peace from events above ground. With the help of genetic research, they adapted their bodies to their new environment and set about rebuilding their once powerful civilization.
Atlantis is still determined to fulfill its aim of finding out more about the gods - and taking revenge on the angels and everything associated with them.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Module CH3: The Temple of Golden Nuts
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In CH3 The Temple of Golden Nuts, the hero's will meet new NPC's as they search for King Stonewall.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: The Mines of Skavhal
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is an adventure for Cepheus Engine.

The travelers are approached to rescue a prisoner from a cruel death on a lifeless vacuum world. The prisoner is being used as slave labor for a penal unit which has contracted itself out to a mining corporation. Life expectancy on this world is short. However, a few of the prisoners, may have other ideas.

boardgame.name: Critical Hits and Wounds
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hit Points are abstract.
Do you feel that your games might like more realistic combat wounds and damage without losing the ease and abstraction of hit points? Would you like critical hits and wounds that create gradations beyond down at 0 up at >0? One that takes into account all types of damage?

This contains six pages, containing information on all damage types, slashing, piercing, bludgeoning, teeth & claws, fire & energy, and cold & nether.

boardgame.name: Hallow Icons
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Before the written word, knowledge was passed on in stories. Myths, folktales, and all the rest are entertaining, yes. However, in all old tales there is a kernel of wisdom, and with wisdom comes power. Power that can be accessed through the impression these stories have left in the primal forces of reality. The purpose of the Akashic Tales line is to take lore, fairy tales, and legends from around the world and extrapolate them into a form that can be wielded by players and GMs alike. All the while spreading a little knowledge about the origins of these bits of human culture and imagination.

boardgame.name: Tales of Arcana 5E Race Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The book you are now reading represents the end result of years reading comics and books, playing video games, watching television and movies, and playing RPGs with friends. I’ve spent a long time on Arcana, combating the corporate soldiers of the Sugar Consortium, exploring the tea party forests of the Purple Realm, and outwitting the mad God Manitous.
...
Tales of Arcana Roleplaying Card Game first began as a roleplaying card game (RPCG) that was funded through Kickstarter in January 2016. A follow-up second set was funded in August 2018, also through Kickstarter. An RPCG uses cards to randomly generate characters. The game was designed for one-time, single-session campaigns where players randomly generate their characters from cards. Its tagline was "Go Outside the Sandbox."
...
Within this guide, players are meant to find races that are expected (elves, dwarves, humans), unexpected (puppets, robots), weird (clowns, cards), and original (storytellers, incgouts, manos). This book strives to continue the spirit of the ToA card game and give players more racial options than any roleplaying book in history.

boardgame.name: We, The Faceless
boardgame.description:
We, the Faceless is a fast playing asymmetrical 4x game.

The Faceless Lords, demigods of torment, march their forces into populations centers, reaping skulls and spreading destruction. Clashing with each other, they devastate the landscape, but the dark magic of the faceless lords seal the gods out of the realm, but also seal in the souls of the slain. Some of these souls come back as the Grieved to fight the Faceless beyond death.

Players select control a Faceless Lord, possessing a dark host of unique powers and minions. They choose a Realm to war over, and set up hex tiles according to a Realm map.

Each round, players draft commands from a shared deck, then reveal cards simultaneously; the card's initiative decides the order of actions. Actions include: Marching minions into settlements, reaping skulls & causing destruction, empowering your minions, and casting spells.

As you devastate the realm you gain Hate, until a player triggers their unique End Times, signaling the last round. At the end of the final round the player with the most Hate wins the game, and overtaking the realm.

boardgame.name: Madison Avenue: Now You Are In The Ad Game
boardgame.description:
In this fast paced, easy to play game that replicates the real world of advertising agencies. YOU are an ad agency president charged with getting more and bigger accounts.

As you go around the board, you will hire staff and pit them against your (hopefully inferior) competitors to pitch and WIN accounts!

It is that simple ... HIRE STAFF and PItch ACCOUNTS. But, Oh, what problems you will experience along the way! Can YOU manage your way to success in the glamorous world of advertising? Or will you be just another "also-ran". It is time to find out!

boardgame.name: Planes Battle Buildings
boardgame.description:
On a planet of lava and ocean, steam shrouds the terrain as mighty mechanical constructs battle each other for sovereignty. Anachronistic aesthetics and wicked machine designs bring the game to life.

Planes Battle Buildings is a 2 to 4 player miniature strategic game. Each player controls a faction of miniature planes or walking buildings.

Players then draw terrain hex cards to reveal and traverse the unknown landscape. The aim is for each player to gain area control, retain enough resources to maintain and expand their collection of planes or buildings. Conflict arises when players battle over terrain or attempt to pilfer the other player's resources.

Game play is either skirmish mode (where one players wins all) or adventure mode where a scenario is chosen with its own unique set of rules for the players to follow.

boardgame.name: Railways
boardgame.description:
In the middle of the 19th century, the time of the Industrial Revolution, you must take advantage of the steam age and build your railroad empire by developing railroads, expanding buildings, and moving passengers to make the most profit at the end of twelve rounds!

Railways is the first game in the "Nano9games" family. With 9 cards, 9 dice, and 9 cubes, you must build a network and connect the buildings to move passengers. You will use cards and icons to perform actions. During each round, play cards to combine icons to perform actions:


Build a link
Move a passenger
Build a building
Upgrade an existing link
Take money
Decrease pollution
Add a new passenger


If you play two icons from the same card, you must increase your pollution. Your goal is to make as much profit as possible, and you earn money when you move passengers through links and buildings...

With a second set of cards — and dice and cubes in a different color — you can play Railways with two players.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Experior Proelium
boardgame.description:
2 to 6 Players
Dice Management - Combat - Competitive - Dungeon Crawler

A group of heroes are hired to venture into a labyrinthine and narrow cave near the kingdom, lair of beasts creatures to complete the mission at the risk of being trapped. One player will handle the creatures, the rest will be the heroes.

The players, including the "boss" player, each turn must throw their dice, with them they will be able to pay for the actions during it.

The cave of the route will be revealed in a random way with the movement of the heroes, with a continuity of terrain cards, but the "boss" can lengthen his path.

There are three possible contracts that the heroes must fulfill, when doing so the heroes will win, otherwise the "boss" player will win.

—description from the designer


2 a 6 Jugadores
Gestión de Dados - Combate - Competitivo - Dungeon Crawler

Un grupo de héroes son contratados para aventurarse en una laberíntica y estrecha cueva cercana al reino, guarida de bestiales criaturas para completar la misión a riesgo de quedar atrapados. Un Jugador manejara las criaturas, el resto serán los héroes.

los jugadores, incluido el jugador "jefe", cada turno deberán arrojar sus dados, con ellos podrán pagar las acciones durante el mismo.

La cueva del recorrido se ira revelando de forma azarosa con el movimiento de los héroes, con una continuidad de cartas de terreno, pero el "jefe", puede ir alargando su camino.

Hay tres contratos posibles que los heroes deberan cumplir, al realizarlo los heroes ganaran, de lo contrario ganara el jugador "jefe".

—description from the designer (Spanish)

boardgame.name: Inner City Redux
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Inner City Redux is a fast-paced roller coaster ride filled with violence and action. It is a light-hearted satire of the popular law enforcement dramas of the television programs and movies prominent in media 40 years ago. Characters play the roles of either crooks or citizens (law enforcement) as they battle their way through the most crime infested city you can possibly imagine.

boardgame.name: Celestial Hacker Girl Jessica
boardgame.description:
Jessica is a magical girl who is also a marble and she hacks computers and dodges lasers and eats cake and also she's in space!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Mörk Jul
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Welcome to a Black Christmas!

Most have left for christmas break but not you. You're there when the killer calls and begins to hunt you! They're out for blood, but why? It's up to you, and your fellow housemates, to find out how to stop this murderous stalker. Thankfully, you aren't just a regular college student. You're a delirious fool, a lost soul, someone well-versed in murderous monsters and crazed killers. Hell, you might well be one yourself!

Welcome to MÖRK JUL!

Where the call is coming from inside a house of lost souls and deadly fools!

boardgame.name: Battletech: Jihad Turning Points – Luthien
boardgame.description:
THE BLACK PEARL UNDER SIEGE
Luthien. The Black Pearl. Jewel of the Dragon. The center of the Draconis Combine, Luthien had never been conquered by an enemy in over four centuries.

Then came the Jihad.

Jihad Turning Points: Luthien fleshes out the details of the conflict surrounding this pivotal world published in various Jihad Plot Sourcebooks. Additionally, players can join one of the myriad of units fighting for control--and survival--of the Combine's capital world. Enemies from within and without seek to cut off the Dragon's head, while loyal samurai fight to save it.

This campaign series uses the Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual battles, following a campaign arc, inserting it into their own campaigns and even create their own scenarios with optional rules to give their games a Luthien flavor. The ebook includes a detailed map of the world of Luthien, a run down of the forces involved in the conflict, and several tracks that players can use to run simple lance-on-lance battles, or stage up to a world-wide invasion. Only the players' imaginations are the limits.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Jihad Turning Points – New Avalon
boardgame.description:
AVALON DARKENED
In 2796 New Avalon almost fell to the ravening Draconis Combine. Yet House Davion rebounded, becoming one of the most powerful of Houses. Since then Avalon City and the capital of the Federated Suns have stood as a beacon of hope for all mankind.

Then came the Jihad.

Jihad Turning Points: New Avalon fleshes out the details of the conflict surrounding this pivotal world published in various Jihad Plot Sourcebooks. Additionally, players can join one of the myriad of forces fighting for control--and survival--of the Federated Sun's capital world.

This campaign series uses the Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual battles, following a campaign arc, inserting it into their own campaigns and even create their own scenarios with optional rules to give their games a New Avalon flavor. The ebook includes a detailed map of the world of New Avalon, a run down of the forces involved in the conflict, and several tracks that players can use to run simple lance-on-lance battles, or stage up to a world-wide invasion. Only the players' imaginations are the limits.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: The Challenges Game System
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Challenges Game System offers an easy-to-play alternative to fantasy game systems which are becoming increasingly complex. All of the basic information needed for play is organized into 8 pages instead of scattered among hundreds of pages of several expensive books.

The Challenges Game System is intended to be a foundation. Game Masters and players can add whatever they like to the system. They can change any rules they want. But the 8 page guide will still remain a basic reference aid, a place where essential information can be quickly found.

The Challenges Game System can be especially useful when playing or Game Mastering any of the various fantasy role-playing adventure modules published by Challenges International, Inc..

boardgame.name: Castaways Guide to Cragbarren
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Find your way to Wreck Haven and build a home and stay put, maybe start a garden or see if you can find some animals to tend to, or do something, but whatever you do, do not leave the safety of the town.
boardgame.rpg: Delve Second Edition: A Dungeon Exploring Fantasy RPG

boardgame.name: Gark the Everdead and Other Tales
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The island of Cragbarren is not what you would call your normal holiday destination, it will not be recommended in the ‘Elven Guide to Exciting places to find Good Food and Fine Wines’ for example. But may actually appear in the depressing tome ‘How to find places that will almost definitely kill you’, but I have never looked.

This collection of adventurers will guide your adventurers from dungeon to cave to tower and back again to dungeon, it is filled with vile monsters, strange places and treasure.
boardgame.rpg: Delve Second Edition: A Dungeon Exploring Fantasy RPG

boardgame.name: Death Note Jinrou
Death Note Werewolf
Death Note 人狼
boardgame.description:
Death Note 人狼 (or Death Note Jinrou, meaning Death Note Werewolf) is a draw one, play one card game with social deduction in the setting of the Death Note manga.

Players are first assigned to two teams – Team L and Team Kira – depending on which True Identity card they are dealt, which include L and Kira themselves, as well as Kira's believers and L's police allies.

Two item cards are then distributed at random to each player, including the Death Note and Arrest cards that Kira and L must use respectively to attain victory. The rest of the item cards form a draw deck. Each player spends their turn drawing one card and playing one of the three cards in their hand.

For Team L, victory lies in getting the Arrest card to L and using it to expose the true identity of Kira. For Team Kira, victory lies in getting the Death Note card to Kira and using it to kill off L while trying to stay incognito.

Things won't be that easy, however. Players have no idea which True Identity card the other players hold, meaning that a Kira player could very well pass himself off as L, getting his hand on the Death Note in the process. You'll need to use the item card abilities, as well as your deduction skills, to prevail.

boardgame.name: 50 Visitors of the Village 5
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list provides 50 different travelers that you might find visiting a fantasy hamlet, village, town, or city. Some folk are innocent and seeking to do business while others are guilty of crimes or fleeing an undesirable situation. Each listing provides the visitor’s name (typically first name and surname), gender, a role/occupation/class, a brief general description, and a bit of a background story.

boardgame.name: 100 Blue Collar Workers 11
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different blue collar workers that are perfect drop ins for a modern/crime role playing game. This list is also useful for survivors for a post apocalyptic or zombie outbreak setting. Included in each entry is first and last name, gender, age, and occupational skill/role.

boardgame.name: 100 Alley Debris Finds
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This one page itemized list contains a hundred different things that the characters might find in the piles of rubble and tossed out debris in a fantasy city’s alleyway.

boardgame.name: 50 Roadside Motel Guests 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 50 different guests that you might find staying at a roadside motel. Included in each entry is first and last name (and sometimes a nickname), gender, age, role, and a general descriptive.

boardgame.name: 100 Dungeon Rubbish Finds
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This one page itemized list contains a hundred different things that the characters might find in that dungeon rubbish pile. Many things are broken, filthy, and/or useless while others still have a degree of wealth. A few items might even provide clues (at GM’s wishes) of the nearby dungeon occupants.

boardgame.name: Fungus Folk
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Fungus Folk (FF), sometimes known as Fungoids, are a curious type of people. Few people can pinpoint where they come from, scientists and scholars can see no way that they arrived naturally into the world and no deity claims them.

Yet, they exist.

boardgame.name: Fae Court Namer
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A fae, sometimes called fairy or fae folk or even fairie, is a mythological creature found in the folklore of multiple European cultures (including Celtic, Slavic, German, English, and French folklore).

Quite often, they are ruled by an aristocracy, a so-called court of nobles and royals. The name of this court can often give a clue to the nature and personality of those who are part of it, but the nature of the fae is often one of trickery, with some names being chosen to intimidate and others have chosen a name to fool the petitioner into letting down their defences.

Publisher's blurb:

The October 15, 2021 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.name: Planar Compass 2: Buccaneers of the Big Black!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The second issue in our interplanar odyssey welcomes you to the deep end of the Astral Sea! Here there be strange sights, ever changing environmental dangers, and monsters the likes of which you’ve never seen.

boardgame.name: Agyaghadsereg
Ejército de Terracota
Terakotowa Armia
Terracotta Army
boardgame.description:
Emperor Qin Shi Huang has passed away. To protect him in the afterlife, a great army in the form of statues of faithful warriors must be assembled to stand guard in the Emperor's tomb. You will be among those tasked with building this magnificent army.

In Terracotta Army, you represent talented craftsmen and artists laboring to build the wondrous assembly of statues. During the game, you collect resources, upgrade your workers, and seek favor with the Emperor's advisors. Your goal is to play a crucial role in the process of creating the terracotta army, and your success is measured in victory points (VPs). During the game, you and your fellow players build the army together, but after the fifth round of the game is over, only one of you — the one with the most points — will stand as the winner.

During the game, you place warrior miniatures within the mausoleum, forming groups. A group's miniatures may belong to multiple players as denoted by the player bases on those miniatures. Multiple separate groups consisting of the same type of miniature may exist within the mausoleum.

You will have many opportunities to score points based on domination and presence. To achieve domination, you must be the only player with the most of the specific resource or type of statue currently being scored. (If you are the only player, you have domination.) To have presence, you must have at least one of the specific resource or type of statue currently being scored.

At the end of the fifth round, the player with the most VPs wins.

boardgame.name: Zapotec: Asymmetrical Player Boards
boardgame.description:
This promo pack is exclusive to the BGG Store and contains 5 asymmetrical player boards for Zapotec. By alternating the placement of the advanced one-time resources on the player board, as well as the positions of the basic resource rows and columns, each player has a unique board, allowing a little bit more customization of resources to obtain as part of the crucial first turn of the game.

The player boards contains in the base game represent one possible configuration, of six. This promo pack provides the remaining five possible configurations.

To use:

Take one of the player boards from the base game and add it to the five provided in this pack.
Shuffle all six (unique) player boards and deal one, at random, to each player.
Proceed with the rest of setup as normal.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mandala Stones: Extension Sérénité
Mandala Stones: Harmony
boardgame.description:
Welcome back to Mandala Stones, a game of tranquility and beauty! After becoming familiar with arranging colorful stones to create stunning works of art, it is time for you to undertake a new challenge.

With a whole new set of 12 stones at your disposal the Mandala board comes with renewed strength: the new stones serve as wild cards! Competing with your friends and family to create beautiful patterns has never been more challenging—and more enjoyable!

boardgame.name: Loot Box #1
boardgame.description:
The Loot Box is a collection of promotional content and small modules for several games published by Board&Dice. Everything has been carefully crafted and designed with you—the players—in mind.

Teotihuacan: City of Gods
• 1 Book of Challenges

The Book of Challenges contains 6 variants for experienced players, all featuring a specific predetermined setup which puts the focus on a certain aspect of game play. Some of these variants also include special rules and victory conditions which add to the difficulty level and change the mindset of player on how to achieve victory.

Tekhenu: Obelisk of the Sun
• 1 Book of Challenges
• 1 cloth bag
• Module: Noble Buildings (including 4 Noble Building tiles)

The Book of Challenges contains 3 variants for experienced players, each adding a twist to the normal setup procedure and some additional flavor to the game play.

The Noble Buildings module gives each player a special Building tile. Once per game, when constructing a Building, whether as a workshop or quarry (Osiris God Action), around the Temple Complex (Hathor God Action), or in a foreign region (Seth God Action), you may place this tile underneath the newly constructed Building. If you do so, double the rewards received.

Tawantinsuyu: The Inca Empire
• 1 Book of Challenges
• 1 cloth bag

The Book of Challenges contains 3 variants for experienced players. Two variants were featured during the Tawantinsuyu Digital World Championship 2021 and are therefore uniquely balanced for 4 players. The third variant is not for the faint of heart, likewise representing an expertly crafted challenge.

Origins: First Builders
• Module: Ophiuchus, the 13th sign of the Zodiac (including a new Zodiac card and accompanying Zodiac tile)
• Module: The Voice (including 5 Voice cards and 1 card with rules)

Ophiuchus lets you choose to resolve the bonus action of an Encounter Site instead of one of the actions normally available.

The Voice gives special powers to the weaker (and, therefore, less desirable) Speaker dice. When taking a Speaker die of value 2 or 3, you may immediately receive the associated benefit depicted on the Voice card before placing the Speaker die in your player area.

Zapotec
• Module: Quick Start (including 10 Quick Start cards and 1 card with rules)

After performing all other setup steps as normal (including starting basic resources), each player is dealt 2 random Quick Start cards from which they will choose 1 card and receive its depicted benefits. Certain Quick Start benefits may even enable a simple Capital action on the first turn.

The Loot Box also contains a special QR code for Escape Tales (containing immersive audio introductions) and 4 custom Scoring markers and a First Player marker for Mandala Stones.

boardgame.name: Teotihuacan: Expert Challenges – Book 3
boardgame.description:
Teotihuacan: Expert Challenges is a series of setups intended to challenge players who are well familiar with the game.

Book 3 contains two challenges.

Book 3: Noble Challenge
Representing a time in history after the completion of the Pyramid of the Sun, this challenge turns the game on its head, requiring a different approach to the game than previously.

Book 3: Explorer Challenge
This is a challenge for the most experienced players. With a by-the-book setup, collecting masks is usually a secondary means of gaining victory points. The Explorer Challenge promotes mask collection to a prime strategy, and it allows very high scores.

boardgame.name: Tekhenu: Book of Challenges
boardgame.description:
The Book of Challenges contains 3 variants for experienced players, each adding a twist to the normal setup procedure and some additional flavor to the game play.

Ancient High-Tech
With this setup, each player receives a significant boost in the form of starting Technologies that synergize well with each other and a predetermined Decree. But do not let this powerful beginning trick you into believing that you can take a more relaxed approach to your actions. Quite the opposite! You must constantly stay alert to make sure no action goes to waste. Recommended for experienced players only.

Restricted, Yet Flexible
Here, you start with a distinctly unique Technology and a flexible blessing. This is countered by only being able to draft a single Starting card. You must exercise great care to ensure that your starting draft offers as much power and flexibility as possible. Of course, the other players will undoubtedly attempt to do the same. Recommended for experienced players only.

Wide Open Strategy
Powerful and balanced card sets and a much less restrictive Card Market truly opens up the game for a proper battle of strategic minds against each other. Recommended for experienced players only.

listing.notes:
Book of Challenges + the official cloth bag
The Book of Challenges contains 3 variants for experienced players, each adding a twist to the normal setup procedure and some additional flavor to the game play.

boardgame.name: Tekhenu: Noble Buildings
boardgame.description: The Noble Buildings is a small-module expansion for Tekhenu: Obelisk of the Sun. During setup, each player receives a special Building tile. Once per game, when constructing a Building, whether as a workshop or quarry (Osiris God Action), around the Temple Complex (Hathor God Action), or in a foreign region (Seth God Action), you may place this tile underneath the newly constructed Building. If you do so, double the rewards received.

boardgame.name: Tawantinsuyu: Book of Challenges
boardgame.description:
The Book of Challenges contains 3 variants for experienced players. Two variants were featured during the Tawantinsuyu Digital World Championship 2021 and are therefore uniquely balanced for 4 players. The third variant is not for the faint of heart, likewise representing an expertly crafted challenge.

Balanced Symmetrical
This is a very balanced game setup for 4 players. It was used during the Tawantinsuyu Digital World Championship 2021 as the setup for the Grand Final. In that particular game, "Bijmeister" secured the win (as player 2) with a final score of 179 points. The player "ooba" clinched second place (as player 4) with 163 points, followed by "Vrarimor" (as player 1) with 144 points, and "Wppxis" (as player 3) with 130 points.

Balanced Asymmetrical
This is a very balanced game setup for 4 players. It was used during the Tawantinsuyu Digital World Championship 2021 as the setup for the Semifinals. Across the four semifinal games, each player position managed to win their table once, thereby securing a spot in the Grand Final that followed a few days later.

Extreme Asymmetry
This is an extremely asymmetrical setup for 3–4 players. While it provides each player with an "all stars aligned" start to the game, the players must play expertly to emerge victorious as letting down one's guard can result in another player gaining the advantage.

boardgame.name: Origins: First Builders – Ophiuchus, the 13th sign of the Zodiac promo card
boardgame.description:
This is a single promo Zodiac card for Origins: First Builders along with its accompanying Zodiac tile.

During setup, the Ophiuchus Zodiac card can be added to those from the base game.

Ophiuchus lets you choose to resolve the bonus action of an Encounter Site instead of one of the actions normally available.

Ophiuchus is a large constellation straddling the celestial equator. It is sometimes used in sidereal astrology as a thirteenth astrological sign in addition to the twelve signs of the tropical zodiac. The constellation Ophiuchus is situated behind the sun from November 29 to December 18.

The 13-sign zodiac, based on IAU constellations, would be:




Sign

Dates



Aries

April 18 to May 13



Taurus

May 13 to June 21



Gemini

June 21 to July 20



Cancer

July 20 to August 10

boardgame.name: Origins: First Builders – The Voice
boardgame.description:
The Voice is a small-module expansion for Origins: First Builders. During setup, a random Voice card is chosen to be used in the game. This Voice card gives special powers to the weaker (and therefore often less desirable) Speaker dice.

When taking a Speaker die of value 2 or 3, you may immediately receive the associated benefit depicted on the Voice card before placing the Speaker die in your player area.

This gives the players a few additional things to consider when competing for Speaker dice.

boardgame.name: Hội Phố (Second Edition)
boardgame.description:
Tiếng Việt ở phần dưới của mô tả*


Hội Phố is a quick Vietnamese themed card game for 3-5 players. During the game, players will try to gain Contracts by having the most money each round or by using Merchant’s skills. The first player to gain a required number of Contracts is the final winner. There are 15 merchants (12 merchants in the 2018 version of Hội Phố) with 15 unique skills and 5 Ship Cards. Players play a card simultaneously and compare reputation, the players who have the highest and second highest reputation merchant gain money while the lowest merchant triggers skill.

Each round contains 4 turns (Player plays 4 out of 5 cards in hand). In a 5 player game, there are only 3 turns per round. Money and cards in hand are always hidden (unless the player is required to reveal it).

Each Turn has the following steps:
Put a card facedown - Reveal a card - Resolve and reward

After finishing the last turn (the 4th turn in a game of 3-4 players or the 3rd turn in a game of 5 players), the round ends.

All players reveal their money and the player with the most money gains 1 Contract card (the top one of the contract deck)

Hội Phố là một trò chơi thẻ về văn hóa Việt Nam dành cho 3-5 người chơi. Trong trò chơi, người chơi sẽ cố gắng đạt được Hợp đồng thương mại bằng cách kiếm nhiều tiền nhất mỗi vòng hoặc bằng cách sử dụng các kỹ năng của Thương gia. Người chơi đầu tiên đạt được số lượng Hợp đồng cần thiết là người chiến thắng cuối cùng. Có 15 thương nhân (12 thương gia trong phiên bản Hội Phố 2018) với 15 kỹ năng độc đáo và 5 Thẻ tàu. Trong lượt, người chơi đồng thời hạ một thẻ và so sánh danh tiếng, những người chơi có thương nhân danh tiếng cao nhất và nhì sẽ nhận được tiền trong khi thương nhân có danh tiếng thấp nhất sẽ kích hoạt kỹ năng.

Mỗi vòng có 4 lượt. Nếu có 5 người chơi, chỉ có 3 lượt mỗi vòng. Tiền và thẻ trong tay luôn được giấu kín (trừ khi người chơi bắt buộc phải tiết lộ).

Đặt một thẻ úp xuống - lật lên và so sánh các thẻ - Lấy thưởng và kích hoạt chức năng

Sau khi kết thúc lượt cuối cùng (lượt thứ 4 trong một trò chơi 3-4 người hoặc lượt thứ 3 trong một trò chơi 5 người), hiệp đấu kết thúc.

Tất cả người chơi tiết lộ số tiền của họ và người chơi có nhiều tiền nhất sẽ nhận được 1 thẻ Hợp đồng (thẻ trên cùng của chồng thẻ hợp đồng”

boardgame.name: Nine-Minute Kingdom
boardgame.description:
9-minute Kingdom – A game that takes 9 or fewer minutes to play!
The goal of the game is to build the kingdom for which we get the most points. The players collect points in two ways: by completing the edicts and by connecting the various icons in their kingdoms.
The game is divided into 9 turns during which the players perform actions simultaneously. The players simultaneously pick one card and play it on the table. Next, they pass the unused cards to the player on the left. Using the received cards, the players play another card and add it to their kingdoms. The game continues to the moment of playing the ninth, final card.
Each played card makes your kingdom grow. You just have to follow 3 simple rules:

Apart from the first card, each following card must be placed adjacent to the card which is already on the table.
Your kingdom has to form 3x3 square.
The cards can be added freely and don’t have to match the ones already added to the kingdom.


After completing their kingdoms the players go to the scoring phase. Firstly, the players receive the edict cards, starting with the „Kingsroad” edict. It goes to the player with the longest connected road in the kingdom. Next, the rest of the edict cards are handed to the players who met their requirements.
Additionally, the players score points for the individual terrains in their kingdom. The terrains with the highest number of different symbols generate points, which are then indicated by the scorecards.
The player with the highest score is the winner.

boardgame.name: Charlottesville
boardgame.description:
This board game, simply named Charlottesville, is similar to Monopoly; players accumulate properties and try to bankrupt the other players. It was created as a business class project by local high school students, in approximately 1987-1988.

The square board is filled with local Charlottesville, Virginia businesses which purchased the spaces. The box is decorated with the same artwork as part of the board. It comes with four pawns; two dice; round plastic chips to use like houses/hotels; play money sponsored by a local bank (Jefferson National Bank); property cards; two sets of 'Chance'-like cards, sponsored by Hallmark stores and the local Seminole Square shopping center; and a rulebook with a brief description of Charlottesville's history and location.

Note that this game is very different from "All About Charlottesville - Albemarle County, VA" which uses a board made from large puzzle pieces and focuses on visiting businesses to complete a shopping list.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Zapotec: Quick Start
boardgame.description:
The Quick Start module adds asymmetrical setup to Zapotec.

After performing all other setup steps as normal (including starting basic resources), each player is dealt 2 random Quick Start cards from which they will choose 1 card and receive its depicted benefits.

The benefits of each Quick Start card may be simple—gain an advanced resource or two, start with a building, etc.—but their impact will be immediately noticeable without disturbing the delicate balance of the actions you take in the game.

In fact, certain Quick Start benefits may enable a simple Capital action on your first turn of the game.

—description from the publsiher

boardgame.name: Kinh Lược 1698
boardgame.description:
Kinh Luoc is a tile laying game for 2-4 players. You are a Cai Bo - an officer supporting Nguyen Huu Canh on his mission to the South. You will be given rights to construct ports and cities, reclaiming forests and plowing fields for immigrants. Do your job well and you will have the love of people.

Summary of game

The game takes place in 3 rounds, each round will have build phase and reward phase. You will try to earn as many points as you can , the player with the most VP at the end of round 3 is the winner.

To set up, each randomly takes 5 tiles from a set of 15 tiles in his color. On your turn, you play a single tile to the table if it meets 2 requirements: connect with a same type building already existing and connect with at least 1 tile of another player. (These conditions may be reviewed separately). The game will be played from left to right. After each player has played 4 project tiles, they discard face up the 5th tile and end the round
At the end of the round, players will collect VPs

Special tile: TAX POST TILE. It is a special project tile as it can connect with all 4 types of Building Zone. When a Tax Post is placed to the table it will collect 1 VP from each project tile that connects with it

At the end of the game, players are awarded a bonus point for:
Connect every project tile of them on the City (5 VPs)
Discard Tax Post (3 VPs)

—description from the publisher (translated)

“Kinh Lược là trò chơi đặt thẻ dành cho 2-4 người chơi. Bạn sẽ là một Cai bộ hỗ trợ Nguyễn Hữu Cảnh đi vào phía Nam. Bạn sẽ được trao quyền xây dựng, quy hoạch các trấn, phủ, khai hoang rừng và phát ruộng cho người dân. Hãy làm tốt công việc của mình và bạn sẽ có được sự tin tưởng của người dân

Tóm tắt trò chơi

Trò chơi diễn ra trong 3 vòng, mỗi vòng sẽ có giai đoạn xây dựng và giai đoạn nhận thưởng. Bạn sẽ cần kiếm được nhiều điểm nhất có thể, người chơi có nhiều VPs nhất ở cuối vòng 3 là người chiến thắng.

Để chuẩn bị, mỗi người lấy ngẫu nhiên 5 thẻ từ bộ 15 thẻ có màu của mình. Trong lượt của mình, bạn đặt một thẻ duy nhất lên bàn và phải đáp ứng được 2 yêu cầu: kết nối với khu vực phát triển cùng loại đã có và kết nối với ít nhất 1 ô của người chơi khác. (Các điều kiện này có thể được xem xét riêng). Chơi lần lượt từ trái sang phải. Sau khi mỗi người chơi đặt 4 thẻ phát triển của mình, họ loại bỏ thẻ thứ 5 còn lại và kết thúc vòng chơi
Vào cuối vòng, người chơi sẽ thu thập VPs

Thẻ đặc biệt: THẺ ĐỒN THUẾ. Nó là một loại thẻ đặc biệt vì nó có thể kết nối với tất cả 4 loại Khu vực xây dựng. Khi một thẻ Đồn Thuế được xuống, nó sẽ thu thập 1 VP từ mỗi ô dự án kết nối với nó

Khi kết thúc trò chơi, người chơi được thưởng điểm cho:
Kết nối mọi ô dự án của chúng trên Thành phố (5 VP)
Bỏ Bưu điện (3 VP)”

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: LÊN MÂM
boardgame.description:
Len Mam is a card game for 2-4 players. You will become siblings, and cook the traditional Tet tray together

Summary of games

The game has 3 stages including going to the market, cooking and completing the dish. After the market closes, players will check their trays and score points. The person having the most points will win. There are 4 traditional dishes that will be cooked including bamboo shoot soup, jellied meat, square glutinous rice cake, and pickled onion. Each dish will correspond to 1 color and need 4 different ingredients to cook
To set up, each player has 5 ingredient cards, the remaining cards will be called a market deck. The turn starts with the oldest person called the eldest brother/sister. The player takes 2 cards from the market deck, chooses 1 of the 2 cards to decide what to cook in turn
Stage 1: Go to the market: You draw ingredient cards from the market deck
Stage 2: Cook: You can put 1-3 cards into the pot. You can put cards that are the same color as the dish you are cooking, or different color cards.
When you play a different color card, you will activate that card's function. However, if there are more different color cards than the number of players + 1, the pot will be destroyed and the dish cannot be completed.

Stage 3: Complete the dish: The dish can only be completed when there are 4 ingredients to cook it (not counting the number of cards). The player who plays the last card to complete the dish will take all the cards on the pot to his tray to score points at the end of the game. If there are more different color cards than the number of players + 1, the pot will be destroyed. The last player playing a different color card will not get the ingredients in the pot, the other players take the ingredient cards from the pot.
At the end of phase 3, a new turn will begin, until the deck of afternoon market cards is taken, the game ends.
Special card: Boiling water card: can be played with any color and is scored at the end of the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

“Người chơi sẽ trở thành các anh chị em trong gia đình, cùng nhau nấu Mâm cỗ ngày Tết cổ truyền.
Tóm tắt trò chơi
Trò chơi trải qua 3 giai đoạn gồm Đi chợ, Vào bếp và Kiểm nồi. Sau khi chợ đóng cửa, người chơi sẽ kiểm tra mâm cỗ của mình và tính điểm. Người được nhiều điểm nhất sẽ chiến thắng. Có 4 món ăn truyền thống sẽ được nấu gồm canh măng, thịt đông, bánh chưng, dưa hành. Mỗi món sẽ tương ứng với 1 màu và cần 4 nguyên liệu khác nhau để nấu
Mỗi người sẽ có sẵn 5 nguyên liệu khi bắt đầu trò chơi, những thẻ còn lại sẽ gọi là chồng thẻ chợ. Lượt chơi bắt đầu từ người tuổi nhất - chị/anh cả. Người chơi lấy 2 thẻ từ chồng thẻ chợ, chọn 1 trong 2 thẻ để quyết định món sẽ nấu trong lượt
Giai đoạn 1: Đi chợ: người rút thẻ nguyên liệu từ chồng thẻ chợ
Giai đoạn 2: Vào bếp: người chơi được bỏ từ 1-3 thẻ nguyên liệu vào nồi. Bạn có thể bỏ nguyên liệu cùng màu với món đang nấu hoặc bỏ nguyên liệu khác màu.
Khi đánh nguyên liệu khác màu, bạn sẽ được kích hoạt chức năng của thẻ đó. Nhưng nếu nồi có số thẻ nguyên liệu khác màu bằng số người chơi + 1 thì nồi sẽ bị phá hoại và món ăn không thể hoàn thành
Giai đoạn 3: Kiểm nồi: Món ăn chỉ được hoàn thành, khi có đủ 4 nguyên liệu nấu món đó (không tính số lượng thẻ). Người chơi đánh thẻ cuối cùng để hoàn thành món sẽ được Lên Mâm và lấy toàn bộ thẻ trên nồi về Mâm của mình để tính điểm vào cuối game. Nếu xuất hiện số thẻ khác màu hơn số được phép, nồi sẽ bị phá hoại. Người cuối cùng đánh thẻ phá hoại sẽ không được lấy nguyên liệu trong nồi, các người chơi khác lần lượt lấy các thẻ nguyên liệu đã được nấu chín trong nồi.
Kết thúc giai đoạn 3, sẽ bắt đầu lượt chơi mới, đến khi chồng thẻ chợ chiều được lấy hết thì kết thúc trò chơi.
Thẻ đặc biệt: Thẻ nước sôi: có thể đánh cùng bất kỳ màu nào và được tính điểm vào cuối game”

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Ăn Ý
boardgame.description:
An Y is a party game for 4-8 players. An Y is a simple party game that promotes interaction between players. The game has humorous questions, will bring fun and surprise moments to players because of the creative answers of friends or two strangers who suddenly share the same strange thought.

Summary of game
The game follows 3 steps:

Open the question card: On the turn, the player flips and reads the question of the first card on the question deck card
Write the answer: All players write their answer on their answer sheet
Compare answers and score points: Players compare the answers. If another player has the same answer, you score points. The more similar answers, the more points you score.


After 10 questions, the game ends, the player who has the most points will win.

The interesting point of the game is the interaction between the players and the humorous questions. The game is suitable for everyone, will be an indispensable part of your gatherings with friends.
—description from the publisher (translated)

“Ăn Ý là một party game cách chơi đơn giản, đẩy mạnh sự tương tác giữa các người chơi. Trò chơi mang đến những câu hỏi hài hước, đảm bảo sẽ đem đến những tiếng cười vui vẻ và những phút giây bất ngờ bởi những đáp án sáng tạo của bạn bè hay hai người xa lạ bỗng chia sẻ cùng một suy nghĩ lạ đời.

Tóm tắt trò chơi
Trò chơi gồm có 3 bước:
1. Mở thẻ câu hỏi
Vào lượt, người chơi lật và đọc câu hỏi của thẻ đầu tiên trên chồng câu hỏi
2. Ghi đáp án
Mỗi người chơi ghi đáp án vào giấy câu trả lời của họ
3. So đáp án và ghi điểm
Người chơi so sánh các đáp, ghi điểm nếu người chơi khác có đáp án giống mình. Càng nhiều đáp án giống nhau, bạn ghi càng nhiều điểm

Sau 10 câu hỏi, trò chơi kết thúc, người chơi ghi được nhiều điểm nhất sẽ chiến thắng

Điểm thú vị của trò chơi nằm ở sự tương tác giữa người chơi và bộ câu hỏi hài hước. Trò chơi phù hợp với nhiều đối tượng, sẽ là một phần không thể thiếu trong các buổi tụ họp của bạn cùng với bạn bè”

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cadbury's Wacky Races Game
boardgame.description:
Cadbury's Wacky Races Game is a promotional Australian board game from the chocolate maker Cadbury. The game was most likely included in Cadbury Showbags (sample bags) purchased during Australia's annual Royal Shows (Fairs)

A simple roll and move game where players must complete 3 laps of a course. There are some detours and instructions that delay the players progress but the first player to complete the 3 laps is the winner

—user summary

boardgame.name: Alea Iacta Est
boardgame.description:
This is a game in the fortified Roman camp of Haltern. The players are legionaries doing their rounds in the camp. They have different buildings to reach and have to end their round in the principia.
It is a roll, move and remove with with action spaces and individual obstacles.
First to reach the goal wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Pitsch-Patsch
boardgame.description:
A mini, action game. Try to grab the chips of the rolled colour with your suction rod.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Stix
boardgame.description:
Stix (a pun on the Danish "stik", meaning trick) is a Rummy-derivative with missions; players draw cards and discard cards trying to assemble a hand that fulfils their mission, and then close the round before the other players also fulfil their missions.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Prinz & Prinzessin
boardgame.description:
Life at court could be so simple: the prince loves the princess and the princess loves the prince. So nothing should actually stand in the way of the wedding. If it weren't for the evil wizard ... and the wicked witch ... and that treacherous court marshal!

You all get one character card face down in your hand, four cards are placed next to each other and also face down in the middle of the table. Always present are the prince, the princess, the good and the evil witch, as well as the good and the evil wizard. Who else is added depends on the number of players.

Depending on which card you are currently holding, you have a certain goal for your turn. The prince and princess want to get married, of course. The evil witch wants to cast a spell on the princess, the evil wizard on the prince. But their respective good versions try to prevent this. If they don't succeed, the court marshal laughs up his scheming sleeve. If the seer sees through the traitor's evil intentions, he has fulfilled his mission. And the court jester? He wants to stage a spectacular wedding.

The game is played over several rounds. In each game round, a character card is dealt to each player. Depending on the character, the player pursues a certain game goal. For example, the prince wants to marry the princess and vice versa.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: I am an Air Traffic Controller 4
boardgame.description:
Since its release in 1998, this air traffic control game has established itself as a long seller, strongly supported by numerous users both inside and outside of aviation fandom.
For the safe flight of aircraft, air traffic controllers play a vital role. We focus on the duties of these controllers in our game scenarios.

To clear the stages, a player should issue directions as a tower controller for safe and effective flight of aircraft. The operation is quite simple, just select an aircraft and click Instruction buttons. Yet as the situation keeps changing according to the directions issued and the timing, clearing the stage always requires precise and correct judgment. Even after game over, you can resume from the middle of the game replay.

The game is set in Haneda Airport (HND/RJTT) in Tokyo, which represents Japan! It is Japan's largest airport both in its reputation and in its performance, as it sports no less than four runways, handling over 80 million passengers annually (domestic/international), with over 400,000 flight slots.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: 1848: The Golden Spike
boardgame.description:
1848: The Golden Spike (aka 1848LT, or "The one true 1862") is a member of the "18xx" series of games. The series is based on 1829, by Francis Tresham. 1848LT is set in the western part of the US.
Two to six players represent investors in railroad corporations, spending their initial capital to buy wholly-owned Private and Subsidiary Companies and shares in Public Corporations and the Credit Mobilier.

The Public Corporations, each controlled by the largest shareholder (its President), build track and run trains in order to earn revenues. These can be paid out as dividends to shareholders or retained to fund further track and rolling stock.
A key feature of 1848LT, as with all the other games in the series, is that the interests of the President and the interests of its shareholders are not identical, so minority shareholders need to be careful in their investments.

Being a President is not without its difficulties, either; bailing out an insolvent Corporation is the sole responsibility of its President.

— user description

boardgame.name: The Church of the Unknown God
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

This is the third installment of the Swords of Light series. It can be played as a standalone in a sandbox campaign, or played in sequence with The Ethurin Hold and The Keep of Dell-ass Raymond.

The adventure is for 5th – 7th level characters. The module is written for Worlds Without Number and could be converted for use with other OSR systems.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Jihad Turning Points – Tharkad
boardgame.description:
THARKAD ABLAZE
Seat of power for the Lyran people since 2407, the frozen shores of Tharkad have sparkled with the might of the merchant princes of House Steiner for centuries.

Then came the Jihad.

Jihad Turning Points: Tharkad fleshes out the details of the conflict surrounding this pivotal world published in various Jihad Plot Sourcebooks. Additionally, players can join one of the myriad of forces fighting for control--and survival--of House Steiner's seat of power.

This campaign series uses the Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual battles, following a campaign arc, inserting it into their own campaigns and even create their own scenarios with optional rules to give their games a ˆ_Ñ??Tharkad flavor.ˆ? The ebook includes a detailed map of the world of Tharkad, a run down of the forces involved in the conflict, and several tracks that players can use to run simple lance-on-lance battles, or stage up to a world-wide invasion. Only the players' imaginations are the limits.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Lore & Legacy Quick-Start Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lore & Legacy is a science-fantasy role-playing game set on the fantastical world of Empyrea, a vast planet laying in the shadows of a mostly forgotten past. On Empyrea, several distinct species, each hailing from distant stars, now live together, picking through the ruins and technology of lost civilisations.
Players are Free-Lancers: intrepid adventurers, hunters, slayers and explorers determined to unravel the planet's many mysteries. It is up to them to protect the populations, lift the veil on ancient lore and reclaim their lost legacies...

This Quick-Start Guide contains all the information you need to play: the rules of the "3d Engine", 4 pre-generated characters, and an introductory adventure.
The game requires a handful of six-sided, eight-sided and ten-sided dice.


Lore & Legacy est un jeu de rôle de Science-Fantasy prenant place dans le monde fantastique d'Empyréa. Sur cette vaste planète cohabitent plusieurs peuples venus d'étoiles lointaines dans un passé désormais en partie oublié. Les joueurs incarnent des Francs-Lanciers, d'intrépides aventuriers, chasseurs, pourfendeurs et explorateurs déterminés à en percer les nombreux mystères. C’est à eux qu’il revient de protéger les populations, lever le voile sur les anciennes légendes et réclamer leur héritage perdu...

Ce Livret de Découverte contient tout ce dont vous avez besoin pour vous lancer : les règles du Moteur 3d, 4 personnages prêts à l'emploi, et une aventure d'initiation.
Nécessite une poignée de d6, d8 et d10 pour jouer.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Jihad Turning Points – Sian
boardgame.description:
SIAN ABLAZE!
The most important world in the Capellan Confederation, the verdant and serene capital has been the seat of the Chancellor's power for centuries.

Then came the Jihad. And more damaging, the betrayal of one of Liao's own blood.

Jihad Turning Points: Sian fleshes out the details of the conflicts that swirl across this pivotal world published in various Jihad Plot Sourcebooks. Additionally, players can join one of the myriad of forces fighting for control--and survival--of the center of House Liao's heart and soul.

This campaign series uses the Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual battles, following a campaign arc, inserting it into their own campaigns and even create their own scenarios with optional rules to give their games a ˆ_Ñ??Sian flavor.ˆ? The ebook includes a detailed map of the world of Sian, a run down of the forces involved in the conflict, and several tracks that players can use to run simple lance-on-lance battles, or stage up to a world-wide invasion. Only the players' imaginations are the limits.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Lore & Legacy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lore & Legacy is a science-fantasy role-playing game set on the fantastical world of Empyrea, a vast planet laying in the shadows of a mostly forgotten past. On Empyrea, several distinct species, each hailing from distant stars, now live together, picking through the ruins and technology of lost civilisations.

Players are Free-Lancers: intrepid adventurers, hunters, slayers and explorers determined to unravel the planet’s many mysteries.

It is up to them to protect the populations, lift the veil on ancient lore and reclaim their lost legacies…

All you need to play is a handful of d6s, d8s and d10s, and the contents of this book, namely:

The complete rules for the 3d Engine system
Descriptions of six playable peoples
Dozens of abilities, spells, and items
A bestiary of 80 creatures and adversaries
3 ready-to-play adventures
6 pre-generated characters
And much more!


Lore & Legacy est un jeu de rôle de Science-Fantasy prenant place dans le monde fantastique d'Empyréa. Sur cette vaste planète cohabitent plusieurs peuples venus d'étoiles lointaines dans un passé désormais en partie oublié. Les joueurs incarnent des Francs-Lanciers, d'intrépides aventuriers, chasseurs, pourfendeurs et explorateurs déterminés à en percer les nombreux mystères. C’est à eux qu’il revient de protéger les populations, lever le voile sur les anciennes légendes et réclamer leur héritage perdu...

Tout ce dont vous avez besoin pour jouer est une poignée de d6, d8 et d10 et le contenu de ce livre, à savoir :

Les règles complètes du système Moteur 3d
Les descriptions de 6 peuples jouables
Des dizaines de capacités, de sorts, d'objets...
Un bestiaire de 80 créatures & adversaires
3 aventures prêtes à jouer
6 personnages pré-générés
boardgame.rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)

boardgame.name: Battletech: Jihad Turning Points – Atreus
boardgame.description:
ATREUS CAST DOWN
Despite centuries of unrest, the Free Worlds League (formed in 2271) is the oldest of all the Great Houses. Its capital, Atreus, colonized during humankind's initial exodus to the stars, is held as the ideal of the democracy prized by the people of the League.

Then came the Jihad.

Jihad Turning Points: Atreus fleshes out the details of the conflict surrounding this pivotal world published in various Jihad Plot Sourcebooks. Additionally, players can join one of the myriad of forces fighting for control--and survival--of the Free Worlds League's capital world.

This campaign series uses the Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual battles, following a campaign arc, inserting it into their own campaigns and even create their own scenarios with optional rules to give their games a ˆ_Ñ??Atreus flavor.ˆ? The ebook includes a detailed map of the world of Atreus, a run down of the forces involved in the conflict, and several tracks that players can use to run simple lance-on-lance battles, or stage up to a world-wide invasion. Only the players' imaginations are the limits.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Silver: Leader promo pack
boardgame.description:
A promo pack for Silver. It is a pack of 2 identical cards. This pack has 2 cards with value zero to replace the zero cards in a set of Silver cards.

The card has a value of 0, and says, " When faceup at scoring: save one other card in your village for the next round."

If you have a Leader faceup at scoring, save one other card in your village for the next round.

At the beginning of the next round, before you view your two cards, replace any card you were dealt with the kept card (facedown), letting your opponents know what the saved card is and where you've placed it. Shuffle the replaced card back into the deck without viewing it.

boardgame.name: Fluxx: Sham-Bo
boardgame.description: Ever wanted to play Fluxx and Ro-Sham-Bo at the same time? Well now you can, insert the Sham-Bo pack into any Fluxx deck and the 3 Keepers, 3 Goals, and 1 Action card will let you be on your way to new interactions in the Fluxx game of your choice.

boardgame.name: L'écho éthérique Nº 01
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

L'écho éthérique est un supplément périodique pour Lore & Legacy, le jeu de rôle de science-fantasy. Tous les mois, nous vous proposerons en prix libre 12 pages de contenu supplémentaire pour le jeu.

Ce premier numéro s'intéresse à la cité-État de Brasto, avec son histoire, ses quartiers et ses figures emblématiques !

boardgame.name: L'écho éthérique Nº 02
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

L'écho éthérique est un supplément périodique pour Lore & Legacy, le jeu de rôle de science-fantasy. Tous les mois, nous vous proposerons en prix libre 12 pages de contenu supplémentaire pour le jeu.

Ce deuxième numéro plonge dans les eaux fangeuses du bourbier de Riben aux nombreux mystères. Contient une nouvelle créature : le terrifiant savrial.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Jihad Turning Points – Dieron
boardgame.description:
Dieron. Prefecture capital, District headquarters, a lynchpin resource and industrial world for the mighty Draconis Combine.

One of the Word of Blake's major successes at the onset of the Jihad, they would not let go of Dieron without a fight.

Jihad Turning Points: Dieron fleshes out all the details of the conflict surrounding this pivotal world published in various Jihad Plot Sourcebooks. Additionally, players can join one of the myriad of units fighting for ultimate control of one of the Dragon's precious resource worlds.
