The Word of Blake has turned the world into a major stumbling block, centered around the ancient and massive Fortress Dieron.

This campaign series uses the Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual battles, following a campaign arc, inserting it into their own campaigns and even creating their own scenarios with optional rules to give their games a "Dieronese flavor." This PDF-exclusive book includes a detailed map of Dieron, a comprehensive list of the forces involved on Dieron during its nine-year occupation, and several Tracks for players can use to run simple lance-on-lance battles or stage a complete world-wide invasion. The only limit is the players' imagination.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: L'écho éthérique Nº 03
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

L'écho éthérique est un supplément périodique pour Lore & Legacy, le jeu de rôle de science-fantasy. Tous les mois, nous vous proposerons en prix libre 12 pages de contenu supplémentaire pour le jeu.

Ce troisième numéro contient la première partie de l'aventure Faux-semblants, qui entraînera les PJ jusqu'au plateau de Krymène, où dort un secret millénaire... et mortel.

boardgame.name: L'écho éthérique Nº 04
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

L'écho éthérique est un supplément périodique pour Lore & Legacy, le jeu de rôle de science-fantasy. Tous les mois, nous vous proposerons en prix libre 12 pages de contenu supplémentaire pour le jeu.

Ce quatrième numéro contient la seconde partie de l'aventure Faux-semblants. Les Francs-Lanciers s'aventurent dans l'épave d'un ancien vaisseau, recelant de nombreux mystères et dangers...

boardgame.name: L'écho éthérique Nº 05
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

L'écho éthérique est un supplément périodique pour Lore & Legacy, le jeu de rôle de science-fantasy. Tous les mois, nous vous proposerons en prix libre 12 pages de contenu supplémentaire pour le jeu.

Ce cinquième numéro propose un tout nouveau peuple jouable, les kéranes, et s’intéresse aux différentes langues parlées sur Empyréa.

boardgame.name: L'écho éthérique Nº 06
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

L'écho éthérique est un supplément périodique pour Lore & Legacy, le jeu de rôle de science-fantasy. Tous les mois, nous vous proposerons en prix libre 12 pages de contenu supplémentaire pour le jeu.

Au programme de ce sixième numéro : une sélection de personnages hauts en couleur pouvant servir de commanditaires, d'alliés, d'adversaires ou de mentors.

boardgame.name: Star Trek Fluxx: Archer Expansion
boardgame.description: 16 new cards for use in any Star Trek Fluxx title. This expansion adds Captain Jonathan Archer from the television series Star Trek: Enterprise to any copy of Star Trek Fluxx.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine Fluxx
Star Trek: The Next Generation Fluxx

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: L'écho éthérique Nº 07
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

L'écho éthérique est un supplément périodique pour Lore & Legacy, le jeu de rôle de science-fantasy. Tous les mois, nous vous proposerons en prix libre 12 pages de contenu supplémentaire pour le jeu.

Ce septième numéro étoffe les règles consacrées aux animaux de compagnie. Il décrit par ailleurs cinq nouvelles créatures : le puissant bradyobate, le fidèle canid, le discret cristallion, l'intimidante dromantide et le massif ptérorqual.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Operational Turning Points – The Red Corsair
boardgame.description:
In 3055, an unknown pirate menace threatened several Lyran border worlds. Known only as the ˆ_Ñ??Red Corsair,ˆ? this brutal pirate leader broke several militias and preyed upon its victims with no mercy. In response to ComStar's pleadings, forces from Clan Wolf and the famed mercenary Kell Hounds pursued the mysterious pirate band across several Lyran worlds to a climactic showdown deep in Clan Wolf space.

Operational Turning Points: Red Corsair opens up the battle for players to join in the fight (as detailed in Michael Stackpole's novel Natural Selection) using the successful Turning Points PDF exclusive format. Return to a time when tensions were high along the Lyran-Falcon border, and one wrong move might spark another interstellar war!

This campaign series uses the Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual Missions and Touchpoints, following a campaign arc, and inserting it into their own campaigns. This PDF exclusive includes detailed information on several of the worlds affected by the Red Corsair, a rundown of the forces involved in the conflict, an overview of the historical campaign, and several tools and tracks that players can use to run historical characters and battles from this time period. Only the players' imaginations are the limits.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: L'écho éthérique Nº 08
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

L'écho éthérique est un supplément périodique pour Lore & Legacy, le jeu de rôle de science-fantasy. Tous les mois, nous vous proposerons en prix libre 12 pages de contenu supplémentaire pour le jeu.

Ce huitième numéro braque les projecteurs sur les bas-fonds de Patéra, avec leur marché noir et leurs organisations criminelles qui entretiennent parfois des rapports troubles avec les Francs-Lanciers...

boardgame.name: L'écho éthérique Nº 09
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

L'écho éthérique est un supplément périodique pour Lore & Legacy, le jeu de rôle de science-fantasy. Tous les mois, nous vous proposerons en prix libre 12 pages de contenu supplémentaire pour le jeu.

Ce neuvième numéro propose une aventure complète, Feu d'origine inconnue. Lancés à la poursuite d'une dangereuse créature, les Francs-Lanciers feront une rencontre d'un nouveau type... et risquent fort de se retrouver à leur tour sur la liste des espèces menacées.

Contient également les descriptions et caractéristiques de deux créatures inédites, le keelut et l'obélophracte.

boardgame.name: L'écho éthérique Nº 10
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

L'écho éthérique est un supplément périodique pour Lore & Legacy, le jeu de rôle de science-fantasy. Tous les mois, nous vous proposerons en prix libre 12 pages de contenu supplémentaire pour le jeu.

Ce dixième numéro propose quelques règles additionnelles concernant l'achat et la vente d'équipement, ainsi qu'une présentation des variantes d'un même objet s'il était fabriqué par des artisans issus de peuples différents.

boardgame.name: L'écho éthérique Nº 11
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

L'écho éthérique est un supplément périodique pour Lore & Legacy, le jeu de rôle de science-fantasy. Tous les mois, nous vous proposerons en prix libre 12 pages de contenu supplémentaire pour le jeu.

Ce numéro propose une aventure complète, Dans le giron des dieux. Les Francs-Lanciers y partent à la recherche d’un arcanologue disparu dans la Mer de poussière...

Il s'agit d'une version remaniée et étendue du scénario de la partie filmée Une simple livraison, diffusée sur YouTube en juillet 2020.

boardgame.name: Star Trek Fluxx: Porthos Expansion
boardgame.description: Star Trek Fluxx welcomes 16 new cards that introduce Porthos and Spot to the beloved card game. This expansion can be used with any or all of the Star Trek Fluxx games.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine Fluxx
Star Trek: The Next Generation Fluxx

boardgame.name: L'écho éthérique Nº 12
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

L'écho éthérique est un supplément périodique pour Lore & Legacy, le jeu de rôle de science-fantasy. Tous les mois, nous vous proposerons en prix libre 12 pages de contenu supplémentaire pour le jeu.

Après plusieurs décennies de paix et de stabilité, le continent d’Énélysion est à nouveau déchiré par la guerre. Le plus secret des peuples empyréens, les agamides, est désormais divisé par une guerre civile dont les répercussions risquent fort d'affecter l'ensemble d'Empyréa...

boardgame.name: L'écho éthérique Nº 13
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

L'écho éthérique est un supplément périodique pour Lore & Legacy, le jeu de rôle de science-fantasy. Tous les mois, nous vous proposerons en prix libre 12 pages de contenu supplémentaire pour le jeu.

Ce numéro continue d'explorer les conséquences de la Guerre Civile Agamide, en particulier dans la Trouée de Xarac, le canyon reliant le Grand Cratère aux régions centrales d'Énélysion.

boardgame.name: L'écho éthérique Nº 14
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

L'écho éthérique est un supplément périodique pour Lore & Legacy, le jeu de rôle de science-fantasy. Tous les mois, nous vous proposerons en prix libre 12 pages de contenu supplémentaire pour le jeu.

Ce numéro décrit la petite ville d'Akri et ses environs. Située aux abords de la région du Grand Cratère, cette cité minière autrefois prospère a connu quelques revers de fortune...

boardgame.name: Battletech: Historical Turning Points – Misery
boardgame.description:
Wolfs' Dragoons, one of the Inner Sphere's most enigmatic mercenary units in the early thirty-first century. The Draconis Combine Mustered Soldiery, one of the most honorable and ruthless military forces among the Great Houses. On the tiny planet of Misery, the culmination of political plotting, jealousy, and fanaticism played itself out to a bloody, exhaustive end.
The extension of the stubborn wills of Jaime Wolf and Takashi Kurita, Misery became a bloody milestone in the history of the Dragoons and a shocking embarrassment to the Dragon's throne. Forever after, Misery became synonymous to both forces as a symbol of pain, dishonor, and unshakable devotion.

Historical Turning Points: Misery returns to an earlier time in BattleTech history, when the mysterious Dragoons were manipulated into a life-or-death battle by the jealousy of a Kuritan warlord, and nearly paid the ultimate price just to survive.

This campaign series uses the Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual battles, following a campaign arc, inserting it into their own campaigns and even create their own scenarios. This PDF exclusive includes a detailed map of the world of Misery, a run down of the forces involved in the conflict, and several tracks that players can use to run simple lance-on-lance battles, or stage the complete, desperate battle for survival. Only the players' imaginations are the limits.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Some Some Convenience Store
썸썸 편의점
boardgame.description:
User Summary

While working part time at a convenience store you download the dating app Some Some on your smartphone where you instantly match with three very different girls: an innocent part-time worker, a foreign trainee who dreams of becoming a singer, and a carefree bodyguard.

Choose which romance to follow up while also taking care of your job.

boardgame.name: Exterris: The Broken Land
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

n the middle of the desert, there is a ring of mountains covered in a cloud of dust. Some claim that inside that dust is a paradise, a relic of the time before the desert, when a mighty empire ruled these lands. A place where the deprivation of desert life does not touch, and riches abound like grains of sand. Others say that only death awaits in the cloud of dust, and that none who enter ever returns.

Exterris can be used as a remote locale in any campaign world, or played in the default setting. It can also be used as the central location in the second installment of Hellebarde's Castles and Crusades Sevich Desert Campaign. This portion of the campaign - The Exterris Adventure Tome - consists of AT-5 plus ONA-17 through ONA-20.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Third League Turning Points – Free Taiw...St. Ives
boardgame.description:
Taiw...St. Ives Free

In 3226, revolutionaries have freed Taiw...St. Ives from the oppression of the Third League. But are the people of Taiw...St. Ives really free? Or are they just trading on oppressor for another? With the Third League unlikely to stand for treason, Taiw...St. Ives will be the center of the universe for a brief period.

Turning Points: Taiw...St. Ives fleshes out the details of the conflict surrounding this pivotal world published in various Third League Plot Sourcebooks. Additionally, players can join one of the myriad of forces fighting for control--and survival--of this instrumental world.

This campaign series uses the Chaos Campaign rules and gives players the option of fighting individual battles, following a campaign arc, inserting it into their own campaigns and even create their own scenarios with optional rules to give their games a ˆ_Ñ??Taiw...St. Ives flavor.ˆ? The ebook includes a detailed map of the world of Taiw...St. Ives, a run down of the forces involved in the conflict, and several tracks that players can use to run simple lance-on-lance battles, or stage up to a world-wide invasion. Only the players' imaginations are the limits.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: China Sea War
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

War erupts across the South China Sea! Taiwan is being invaded by the People’s Liberation Army and Western navies struggle to contain the influence of a militaristic China in the South China Sea. Vietnam, a Western ally, is also invaded by China, and the Philippine Insurgency gets a boost from Chinese special force advisors. Face down modernized, well-trained PLA forces!

China Sea War is a campaign premise for Zozer Games’ Modern War RPG. It is a tool-kit that provides various situations, mission ideas and squad templates that allow players to fight the Chinese invaders in one of several national armies, at one of several battlefronts, each different from the rest. China Sea War includes new vehicles, new weapons and a list of national armies and deployed units.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Aerospace Battlemat
boardgame.description:
Aerospace BattleMat was made available exclusively at GenCon 2021.

It is a double-sized, double-sided 36” x 22" neoprene map with an aerospace theme. Side A is Aerospace #1 and Side B is Planetary Invasion #1.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: Strategic Operations – Advanced Aerospace Rules

boardgame.name: TrymenT
TrymenT -AlphA-
TrymenT ―Ima o Kaetai to Negau Anata e―
TrymenT ―Ima o Kaetai to Negau Anata e― AlphA
献给渴望改变的你
boardgame.description:
A new season, a new environment, a new campus life. On the deck of a large passenger ship in the station, the view is immediate, and others are new life styles. A girl who is a swordsman, a wheelchair-like girl on the deck.

Gunzan grabbing this piece of land separation area. Convenience store, Convenience store, Convenience store, Convenience store, Convenience store, Convenience store, Convenience store. This trivial general is here.

A boy with a general appearance, Sho Kimishima, a spectator, an island, and a feeling of incontinence. Opening and unloading car-like sneak-thief car overturned car.

Two famous girls outside the metropolitan area.

Participation in the inquiry and inquiry.

Source: The Publisher Website. (using Google Translate)

boardgame.name: Paranormal HK
港詭實錄ParanormalHK
港詭實錄
boardgame.description:
User Summary

First person horror game set in Hong Kong and based upon the urban legends of the Kowloon Walled City as a group of young people gather to make a short film during the Hungry Ghost Festival, where one member after the other disappear.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Strana Mechty BattleMat
boardgame.description:
Every Warrior can make the pilgrimage back to the Clan Homeworlds to fight on sacred land. This neoprene map is a double-sized 22" x 36" battlefield. One half of a giant "Circle of Equals" for Grand Melee battles on the first side, while the reverse side is the Bloody Basin, Lechenka District (from the Battletech novel Prince of Havoc). A rules booklet for the maps is also included.

Strana Mechty Battlemat was an unlockable stretch goal for the 2019 Clan Invasion crowdfunding campaign, which ran from 18 July 2019 to 18 August 2019.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Clank!: A Deck-Building Adventure – Twinples
boardgame.description: Meeples characters for Clank!

boardgame.name: Telestrations: 80s & 90s Expansion Pack
boardgame.description: Be kind and rewind to the 80s and 90s with this radical expansion pack for the award-winning game Telestrations, featuring decades-inspired words and phrases that will have you sketching out the tunes, fads, and fashion from the end of the 20th century. Double-sided cards let you easily flip between the two eras and add “da bomb” new sayings to your existing Telestrations game! *This is not a standalone game.

boardgame.name: Boxing Fighter ; Arcade Game
Boxing Fighter: Super punch
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Arcade style boxing game where enemies keep coming at you.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Reinforcements – Clan Invasion
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

Calvary Incoming!
In the heat and terror of battle, as enemy troops force you back and defeat seems at hand, nothing brings a smile like the sight of reinforcements!

Catalyst Game Labs offers a full line of high-quality, fully assembled plastic miniatures for BattleTech. But when you're looking for a quick and easy opposing force to face on your gaming table, Reinforcements: Clan Invasion provides the bevy of additional units you need.

This box includes nearly 200 full-color, high-quality stand-ups, covering all of the redesigned 'Mechs and Elementals from the hugely successful BattleTech: Clan Invasion crowdfunding campaign. Also included are 248 record sheets covering each 'Mech's primary variants and configurations. A double-sized map features the first-ever depictions of the Plain of Curtains and the Great Gash on the world of Twycross, two of the key battlefields of the Clan Invasion. Finally, a die-cut sheet of Support Units and Diabolis storm tokens - with corresponding rules - bring Twycross to life on your tables.

The Reinforcements: Clan Invasion box is a supplement to the A Game of Armored Combat and Clan Invasion boxes, as well as Total Warfare which are required to use this set.

Contents:
• 9 punchboards of nearly 200 additional 'Mech standees.
• 248 Record Sheets contained in 3 Booklets.
• One double-sided 36″ x 22″ game-map
- Plain of Curtains
- Great Gash
• Punchboard of Support Units and Diabolis storm tokens.
• 3 page rule booklet for the maps / tokens.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Stickman Maverick: Bad Boys Killer
boardgame.description:
User Summary

The Stickman soldier is on a mission to kill all the bad guys coming against him! Upgrade your weapons and kill the enemy - or die trying!

boardgame.name: Battletech: Alpha Strike – Dropships and Small Craft Cards
boardgame.description: BattleTech: Alpha Strike Cards – DropShips & Small Craft provides players with unit cards to bring these units to your Alpha Strike or BattleForce games. Featuring dropships & small craft from across the range of technical readouts and other sourcebooks, this product contains nearly 200 dropships & small craft. Note that DropShips & Small Craft are playable in standard Alpha Strike games based on ground and atmospheric combat, Alpha Strike space combat requires the Alpha Strike Companion.

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Warships and Jumpships Cards
boardgame.description: BattleTech: Alpha Strike Cards – WarShips & JumpShips provides players with unit cards to bring these units to your Alpha Strike or BattleForce games. Featuring WarShips & JumpShips from across the range of Technical Readouts and other sourcebooks, this product contains over 140 WarShips & JumpShips. Note that Alpha Strike space combat requires the Alpha Strike Companion in addition to the Alpha Strike: Commander’s Edition rulebook.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Caveat Emptor
boardgame.description:
After Gray Monday, the Republic has descended into a new Dark Age, ploughshares are being turned back into swords, and the jackals are feeding on the confusion. The desperate need for weapons of new militaries arising everywhere sees mundane machines strapped with outlandish weapons, flamboyant arena ’Mechs returning to the battlefield, and renowned manufacturers engaging in uncharacteristic experimental gambles. It is a seller’s market; anything goes and no price is too high. Caveat emptor—the dust will settle quicker on your new acquisition’s battlefield debut than on the transaction that got you there. You won’t have time for buyer’s remorse.

Experimental Technical Readout: Caveat Emptor samples production and prototype machines that have earnt infamy after Gray Monday as inefficient monstrosities sold to the highest bidder. Each unit featured in this book incorporates some of the new technologies that debuted in Tactical Operations (or quirks found in the BattleMech Manual)—now employed on battlefields of brush wars on former Republic worlds. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new advanced and experimental BattleMechs, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: MonsDRAWsity: Robots
boardgame.description:
MonsDRAWsity: Robots is the next thematic expansion for MonsDRAWsity, adding 50 more monsters to the game, new variant rules, and a 10th player board! Will you be able to memorize, describe, and draw these magnificent machines, or will your wires get crossed?

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Vampire!: A Retro Horror Card Game
boardgame.description:
A SUMMER NIGHT IN 1957. ANYTOWN, USA.

You are a group of small town Locals. But one of you is secretly the Vampire... and you're thirsty for blood.

Together, the Locals must identify the Vampire, reduce it to 1 hit point, and kill it with a Wooden Stake card. But they have to be careful: the Vampire is working to turn them against each other. And if they kill the wrong player, the Vampire will raise them from the dead as a Vampire Fledgling!

Inspired by The Twilight Zone and a real childhood nightmare, The Vampire! pairs the drama of the hidden role genre with the crunch of traditional card games.

[Description by the publisher.]

boardgame.name: City Planner
boardgame.description:
City Planner is a 9 cards, 9 cubes, 9 dice version of Town Center mixed with Card City and dice. Your Small City is divided into several blocks that contain different boroughs (Residential, Commerce, Industry, Cultural Buildings, City Hall or mixed zoning of Residential and Commerce).

It is a dice game where you decide where to place/block/affect the dice to get the most money/VP.

During the game players will do the following four phases in order: Rolling Dice, Passing a Card, Scoring All Cards, Turn End.

The game ends after 8 rounds.

Cover artwork by - Ilya Baranovsky

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Renaissance Wars: Masterpiece Edition Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Masterpiece Edition expands the game into a 5 or 6 player game. It may also be used in a standard 2-4 player game with modification of the envelopes.

Masterpiece cards can be used in conjunction with standard cards to complete standard Melds or on their own to complete Masterpiece melds providing ways to score even more points.

Contents:

14 Masterpiece cards
1 Rules sheet w/Masterpiece Meld Guide


This expansion was available as an add-on during the Kickstarter campaign and later through the publisher website.

boardgame.name: Yu-Gi-Oh Tabletop RPG
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the world of Yu-Gi-Oh where monsters and magic are common and so is danger! This place is rife for adventurers as yourself! In this TTRPG you’ll assume the role of a “monster” in this world.

Monsters can be anything from humans, elves, fiends, and machines and you won’t be dueling with cards, but rather be the monsters, spell, and trap cards you’d see from the Duel Monsters game!

With this world being vast, there’s plenty of areas to discover from valleys, to underground rivers, lairs, castles, and more!

boardgame.name: The Termite
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Villains Abound details super-powered villains for your Savage Worlds game. In this release is presented the Termite. A demolitions expert wanted for wanton sabotage, he stole a suit of armor being developed by the Army to attack an enemy's infrastructure in order to become the saboteur-for-hire, the Termite.

The Termite sabotage suit is flight capable and enhances its wearer's reflexes and strength. Furthermore, it emits acid through its palms that allows it to burrow through the ground, degrade structures, or rot organic material.

boardgame.name: The Gamemaster
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Villains Abound details super-powered villains for your Savage Worlds game. In this release is presented the Gamemaster. A master assassin who creates complex scenarios based upon pop and geek culture references with which to kill his prey, the Gamemaster is as deadly as he is both a genius and annoying.

The Gamemaster operates a customizable facility within which to capture, toy with, and kill his prey. His gadgetry and inventiveness has allowed him to arm himself with working replicas of gear and weapons taken out of his reference materials. He may seem like a joke, but once you enter his Dungeon, you'll need more than lucky rolls to survive an encounter with the Gamemaster.

boardgame.name: Yet 10 More HQ Add-Ons
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

'Beef up your Headquarters with Super-Powered: Yet 10 More HQ Add-Ons

This installment of our Super-Powered series for the Savage World rules provides 10 new add-ons for headquarters following the format presented in the Super Powers Companion (Second Edition.)

Within this brief Super-Powered: Yet 10 More HQ Add-Ons PDF you will find:

6 new HQ rooms: the Dock, Game Room, Gym, Inventor Lab, Pool, and Trophy Room.
3 new HQ Extras: Escape Tunnel, Landmark, and Self-Destruct.
1 new HQ Hindrance: Famous.

boardgame.name: Hush
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A paranoid, conversational game of finding community among a great stillness.

For 2-5 Strangers and 1 Keeper of Silence.

boardgame.name: Headquarters Construction Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Headquarters Construction Guide for Savage Worlds Expands Your Base Building Possibilities

The Headquarters Construction Guide for the Savage Worlds rules collects all of our Super-Powered HQ Add-Ons releases. We have combined all the material from these four previously released Super-Powered products: 10 HQ Add-Ons, 10 More HQ Add-Ons, Yet 10 More HQ Add-Ons, and Yet 10 More HQ Add-Ons … Again.

We've listened to customer feedback and additional playtester input to change some of this previously released content, but we've also added a lot more. In addition to the 10 headquarters add-ons featured in each of the previously released products (totaling 40 add-ons), the Headquarters Construction Guide for Savage Worlds contains additional content we've not previously published.

You will find within the Headquarters Construction Guide for Savage Worlds:

14 new or expanded HQ rooms, ranging from the Animal Lair to Expanded Command Center to Vault.
35 new HQ extras, ranging from the Animal Security Force to Self-Destruct to Weather System.
And introducing 14 HQ hindrances, ranging from Accessible Bowels to Security Gap to Weak Defenses.

boardgame.name: Organizations
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Super-Powered: Organizations Scales Up Your Villains and Heroes

This installment of our Super-Powered series for the Savage World rules provides rules for designing Organizations following a format very similar to creating characters. Using these rules, organization are quick to build and easy to use in your games in a way that makes sense.

Within this Super-Powered: Organizations PDF you will find a step-by-step process for building organizations. Each organization has attributes, skills, Hindrances, and Edges, just like characters. However, details like the amount of people in the organization are purposefully kept abstract so you can scale encounters to your group of heroes, no matter how big or small.

Organizations designed with these new rules provide enough substance to get a solid idea of what the group does, what it is capable of, and what its strengths and weaknesses are. However, they remain sufficiently detail-lite to remain adaptable and not slow down gameplay.

This product includes organization game stats for three previously published organizations, found in other Misfit Studios products: A.E.G.I.S., International CrimePrev Technologies, and Operation: Marshal Law.

Although intended for use in super hero genre games using the Super Powers Companion (Second Edition), Super-Powered: Organizations enables you to build organizations for any genre. Create a brotherhood of space pirates for your science fiction game, for example, or a secret order of assassins for your fantasy game.

boardgame.name: Organizations (Deluxe Adventure Edition)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Super-Powered: Organizations (SWADE) Scales Up Your Villains and Heroes

Updated for Savage Worlds Adventure Edition (SWADE)!

This updated and revised installment of our Super-Powered series for Savage Worlds provides rules for designing Organizations following a format very similar to creating characters. Organizations are quick to build and easy to use in your games in a way that makes sense.

Within Super-Powered: Organizations, you will find a step-by-step process for building organizations. Each organization has attributes, skills, Hindrances, and Edges, just like characters using the SWADE rules. However, details like the amount of people in the organization are purposefully kept abstract so you can scale encounters to your group of heroes, no matter how big or small.

Organizations designed with these updated rules provide enough substance to get a solid idea of what the group does, what it is capable of, and what its strengths and weaknesses are. However, they remain sufficiently detail-lite to remain adaptable and not slow down gameplay.

This product includes organization game stats for three previously published organizations, found in other Misfit Studios products: A.E.G.I.S., International CrimePrev Technologies, and Operation: Marshal Law.

boardgame.name: GPH1: Alabaster Alcazar of the Earth Genies
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wherein our adventurers seek out the Topaz of Earthly Perfection reputed to be held within a mountainside palace. A dungeon for four to seven high-level characters. Drop in to any high level campaign. OSR-compatible.

boardgame.name: GPH1: Alabaster Palace of the Dao
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The First in a Series of Jewel Heists at the End of the Multiverse

Wherein our adventurers seek out the Topaz of Earthly Perfection, reputed to be held within an extraplanar mountainside genie retreat.

A D&D 5E adventure for 4-7 characters of 11th-14th level.

boardgame.name: GPH2: Coral Palace of the Marid
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Second in a Series of Jewel Heists at the End of the Multiverse

Wherein our adventurers seek out the Emerald of Aquatic Perfection, reputed to be held within an extraplanar undersea genie basilica.

A D&D 5E adventure for 4-7 characters of 12th-15th level.

boardgame.name: Delver (Issue #2 - Nov 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Delver Magazine is a bi-monthly (6 issues per year) resource for GMs of Old School RPG fantasy games such as Old-School Essentials, Basic Fantasy Role-Playing Game, and other OSR games. Each issue will include a ready-to-play adventure, printable props, random charts & tables, articles, and maps for the included adventure.

Table of Contents for Issue #2



Random Charts & Tables

(Each of the listings below is a page of random charts/tables)

A Day's Travel
Townsfolk Don't Go There
An Unusual Fountain
Build a Brigand
Found Map
Ixra's Wondrous Tomes
Goblin Merchant
Library of N. Whisperwalk
The Ally: Magic-User
The Apothecary
Merchant: Orris
Wanted Poster
Agnaddob's Artifact Emporium
Nemesis: Cleric
Ancient Stones
What's in the Cube?
Griffon Claw Auction House
Another Day's Travel
Found Map 2
A Cave Entrance
Local Villain
Build a Hag
An Unusual Lantern
Ixra's Wondrous Tomes 2
Griffon Claw Auction House 2
Wizard in the Corner


Article(s)

The Referee Roundtable - Steal Your Setting from a Wargame


Adventure

Curse of the Goblin Vault - 18 page adventure

boardgame.name: GUILD: Societies for Explorers & Adventures
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

GUILD zine is a new resource for OSR games. When adventurers aren't deep in the heart of some dangerous dungeon, they can be busy researching their next exploration using the incredible resources collected by various guilds dedicated to locating and mapping the lost tombs, crypts, and halls of structures lost to the ages.

Guilds can offer their members unique resources, knowledge, and tools for their trips into the unknown... but are your players worthy enough for membership?

Inside, GMs/Referees will find five unique guilds currently looking for new members and offering some amazing resources... for a cut of the loot, of course. Each guild has random charts and tables to roll on, secrets for members to learn and keep, special magical items and relics that are only available to guild members, and more.

boardgame.name: Dungeon ADVENTURE! (Revised)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Weclome to the Revised Edition of Dungeon ADVENTURE!

This new edition of the game features an overview of the Kingdom of Severni, the default campaign setting for the game. It also includes a new character class—the Artificer—new class features, and new rules to make player characters more diverse and interesting at lower levels.

As with the previous edition, the revised version of Dungeon ADVENTURE! features intuitive and flexible rules that allow players to quickly create fantasy heroes for one or more sessions of epic adventure. It comes with just about everything you need to play, including a complete introductory adventure. All you need to provide are your d20s, d6s, pencils, paper, friends, and imagination!

boardgame.name: Mergenfahr and the Coast
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Skadian settlers have dwelt on the coast since the fall of the Soldarian Empire, sharing their knowledge of ship building, their ancient and strange faith, and the secrets of their runic magic, whose practitioners can work wonders the envy of any sorcerer.

This setting guide describes the Township of Mergenfahr, part of the Kingdom of Severni, as well as the villages it governs and the myth-shrouded and dangerous islands of the North Sea. It also details over fifty unique villagers with which players can interact. The guide includes The Encroaching Shadow, a complete adventure that takes place in Mergenfahr’s churning coastal waters.

boardgame.name: Navarre and the Witchwood
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Many adventurers have journeyed to Navarre. Some to outrun their past misdeeds. Others to pick over ruins for lost treasures and Sorcery. Still others to make the enchanted Witchwood forest safe for its inhabitant by riving out the fell beasts, Spirits of the Wild, and Chaos cultists.

This setting guide describes The Witchwood and the Township of Navarre, which lies within it. It also describes Navarre’s unusual settlements and the Ruins, Places of Power, and Other Worlds that can be found within the Witchwood. It also details over fifty unique villagers, spirits, and otherworldly beings with which players can interact. The guide includes

Lunabella and the Unicorn, a complete adventure that takes place within the Witchwood.

boardgame.name: Pippin's Wedge and the Valley
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The sleepy township of Pippin’s Wedge sits nestled in a mountain valley on the northwesternmost edge of the Kingdom of Severni. It is a place that adventurers pass through on their way to more interesting locations, such as the orkan controlled Drok’orcana Mountains, or the bustling hub of trade and intrigue that is Silverton, the county seat.

This setting guide describes the Township of Pippin’s Wedge, the villages it governs, and the features of the valley that lies to its west. It also details fifty unique villagers with which the players can interact. The guide includes The Colossus of Wedge’s Crossing, a complete module that takes place in the valley.

boardgame.name: Due Process
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).





Due Process is an online multiplayer first-person shooter. Players in a match are in one of two teams, each which plots out their tactics for navigating the procedurally-generated map before moving into action against the enemy team.

boardgame.name: Underground City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Have you ever wanted to explore a subterranean city?

Underground City is the perfect map for your next adventure. The map includes a tavern, houses, and timber walkways that cover chasms leading deep into the darkness of the earth. This map is perfect for VTTs like Roll20 or Foundry ,as well as printing at home!

Explore this dwarven city today with this detailed battlemap! It includes everything you need to run an exciting game session with your friends, like detailed buildings that can be used as player homes or shops; walkways spanning deep chasms; long meandering roads that lead off into the underdark… and more! It even has a unique adventure prompt written just for it.

boardgame.name: Ruined Sky City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You’ve been tasked with exploring an ancient floating city above a maelstrom. The inhabitants of the city were killed when the storm swept through and now it is full of evil creatures that are looking to do the same to your party!

This map was created for use in tabletop roleplaying games like Dungeons & Dragons or Pathfinder, but can also be used as a backdrop for most other game systems. It comes with all the files you need to print out at home or upload to your favorite VTT. Plus, there’s even an adventure prompt included so you can start playing right away!

boardgame.name: Ruined City of the Sunken Horror
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Do you love D&D? Are you a fan of HP Lovecraft's Cthulhu mythos?

If so, then this Ruined City of the Sunken Horror 40x30 Battlemap is for you! This map features a ruined city of Lovecraftian horror. The shattered streets are littered with rubble. The buildings have been destroyed by some unknown force. And in the center of it all is an empty circle where an ancient altar dedicated to Cthulhu himself used to be!

You can use this map as part of your own D&D campaign or print it out at home and use it on your tabletop game. Either way, we’re sure that you will find something amazing inside these pages!

boardgame.name: Bandits Underdark Crystal Castle
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your players are bored with the same old dungeon maps, and you can't think of a good adventure idea.

The Underdark is a vast subterranean network connecting myriad tunnels and caverns. It's full of mystery, danger, and ancient relics from civilizations long dead. As such, it's incredibly easy to hook into a short, one-shot adventure with. That's why we created this dark crystal fortress map for you to use with its adventure prompt, or as part of your campaign world!

By combining this battlemap with our detailed adventure prompt (included) you have everything you need to run an epic D&D session that will keep your party engaged until the end!

boardgame.name: Pirates Coastal Castle Ruins Outpost
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The sea is a dangerous place, and pirates are constantly fighting for their lives.

Pirates have to live somewhere! And they need places to store their loot! But it's hard to find good real estate on the coast because there aren't a lot of options.

This coastal castle ruins outpost will let you build your home right on the ocean shoreline, with plenty of room for all your pirate needs. It has multiple floors and rooms to defend yourself from royal navies with. Inside this fortress, you'll get everything you need so that no one will ever know where your treasure is hidden, not even yourself!

boardgame.name: Born in the US: 2010s
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

There are lots of name lists out there, so what makes this one different?

When creating a single character we can choose their names based on the name’s meaning, or how it sound, or what names we like, but what happens when the players ask the name to a barman you barely thought about? Or to an NPC you made up on the fly because they decided to follow something that resembled a clue but that you didn’t intended as such?

Some GMs decide names on the fly, unconsciously drawing from their own experience, but that is a rather limited pool of names and lots of NPCs end up named as John, Jack or Michael. Some GMs use celebrities’ names to instantly get an appearance and maybe a personality, but that pool is just as small and maybe you don’t want those NPCs to be as obvious. Some GMs even hand-wave the names so the players know which persons are important and which ones are atrezzo. Last, some GMs use names lists.

There’s nothing wrong with names lists, I have used them myself, but they have the problem of frequency. The names “Maud” and “Michael” have the same chance because they both appear once, but in real world they don’t. Adding racial ancestry to the NPC can make the problem worse, making a lot of NPCs in a Triads Gangs story share the surnames Lee, Wang or Yen.

Those two problems are what we try to address in this notebook.

Each of the five hundred entries includes information about gender and racial ancestry along with spaces for you to write your own notes when creating a NPC on the fly, just so you can print a bunch of pages and use them in your session or during prep.

This work uses the public information in the United States census to consider names and surnames with regards both at how frequent they are statistically and how frequent they are statistically to a particular racial ancestry.

boardgame.name: Born in the US: 2000s
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

There are lots of name lists out there, so what makes this one different?

When creating a single character we can choose their names based on the name’s meaning, or how it sound, or what names we like, but what happens when the players ask the name to a barman you barely thought about? Or to an NPC you made up on the fly because they decided to follow something that resembled a clue but that you didn’t intended as such?

Some GMs decide names on the fly, unconsciously drawing from their own experience, but that is a rather limited pool of names and lots of NPCs end up named as John, Jack or Michael. Some GMs use celebrities’ names to instantly get an appearance and maybe a personality, but that pool is just as small and maybe you don’t want those NPCs to be as obvious. Some GMs even hand-wave the names so the players know which persons are important and which ones are atrezzo. Last, some GMs use names lists.

There’s nothing wrong with names lists, I have used them myself, but they have the problem of frequency. The names “Maud” and “Michael” have the same chance because they both appear once, but in real world they don’t. Adding racial ancestry to the NPC can make the problem worse, making a lot of NPCs in a Triads Gangs story share the surnames Lee, Wang or Yen.

Those two problems are what we try to address in this notebook.

Each of the five hundred entries includes information about gender and racial ancestry along with spaces for you to write your own notes when creating a NPC on the fly, just so you can print a bunch of pages and use them in your session or during prep.

This work uses the public information in the United States census to consider names and surnames with regards both at how frequent they are statistically and how frequent they are statistically to a particular racial ancestry.

boardgame.name: Born in the US: 1990s
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

There are lots of name lists out there, so what makes this one different?

When creating a single character we can choose their names based on the name’s meaning, or how it sound, or what names we like, but what happens when the players ask the name to a barman you barely thought about? Or to an NPC you made up on the fly because they decided to follow something that resembled a clue but that you didn’t intended as such?

Some GMs decide names on the fly, unconsciously drawing from their own experience, but that is a rather limited pool of names and lots of NPCs end up named as John, Jack or Michael. Some GMs use celebrities’ names to instantly get an appearance and maybe a personality, but that pool is just as small and maybe you don’t want those NPCs to be as obvious. Some GMs even hand-wave the names so the players know which persons are important and which ones are atrezzo. Last, some GMs use names lists.

There’s nothing wrong with names lists, I have used them myself, but they have the problem of frequency. The names “Maud” and “Michael” have the same chance because they both appear once, but in real world they don’t. Adding racial ancestry to the NPC can make the problem worse, making a lot of NPCs in a Triads Gangs story share the surnames Lee, Wang or Yen.

Those two problems are what we try to address in this notebook.

Each of the five hundred entries includes information about gender and racial ancestry along with spaces for you to write your own notes when creating a NPC on the fly, just so you can print a bunch of pages and use them in your session or during prep.

This work uses the public information in the United States census to consider names and surnames with regards both at how frequent they are statistically and how frequent they are statistically to a particular racial ancestry.

boardgame.name: Oct 15, 2021
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: Classic Dungeon Crawl

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map

boardgame.name: Oct 22, 2021
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Map Theme: Temple of the Stars

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map

boardgame.name: Renaissance Wars: Kickstarter Exclusive Stretch Goal Cards
boardgame.description:
A set of 11 cards that were made available as exclusives to Kickstarter backers. They are mixed in for use with the standard cards in the set:

Contents:
- 1 Money in the Bank card
- 2 Populace cards
- 2 Immediate Intrusion cards
- 2 Immediate Event cards
- 4 Personal Action cards

boardgame.name: Fizban's Vault of Draconic Secrets
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Fizban’s secrets are finally ready to be revealed. Inside these pages you will find a wealth of never-before-seen draconic power, including:

• 13 subclasses
• 2 backgrounds
• 10 spells
• 5 feats
• 10 magic items
• 3 hoard magic items
• 5 draconic gifts
• 50 trinkets
• 41 adventure hooks
• Plus a new type of familiar... the dragonling!

Whether you are looking to bring draconic flair to character creation or level up your game with feats, spells, or magic items, this book has what you need. Open the vault and discover the secrets that await you!

boardgame.name: Buado: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
Carefully utilize the every-player-shared main deck cards and take down the other Kings with your own King and Equipment!

Have your Bear attack an opponent’s King once you’ve broken all of that King’s shields to win!
There are 3 Win conditions:

Hit an opponent's King once with a Bear when the opponent does not control any Shields or Bears of their own.
Drawing the last card.
Control the all Muse-a-Bears: John, Dhruv, and Matt.



During their turn, players play Bear, King, Shield, and equipment cards take down the other kings.

boardgame.name: Experior Portales
boardgame.description:
1 to 3 Players
Deckbuilding - Dice Management - Strategy - Solitary - Cooperative - Competitive

This game incorporates into the world of Experior, not only the Dark Epic Fantasy, already present in other games of the line, but also includes Science Fiction from different evolutionary paradigms, telekinetic developments, steampunk technology, Cyberpunk, worlds of almighty beings, anomalies, mutations and aberrations.

Starting from an asymmetric deck of 10 basic cards, each player will throw basic dice, exchange the cards in their hand for more dice, use their abilities or enhance other abilities already triggered. The combinations of use are infinite and these will depend on what the dice dictate, being able to also get new cards, buy improvements or travel through the portals, taking them to uncertain destinations. There you can fight or find objects or more fissures that will allow you to continue traveling.

In solo mode, the player must close a number of portals, while the automa will take time away from the game. The player has an initial life, if the automa consumes the time or the player's life reaches zero, the player loses.
In competitive mode, it will be a race between players to see who manages to close the portals first.

—description from the designer


1 a 3 Jugadores
Deckbuilding - Gestión de Dados - Estrategia - Solitario - Cooperativo - Competitivo

Los manipuladores de energía pueden cerrar las fisuras, entrada de los Mitos a nuestro mundo. Para esto deben viajar a través de ellas como portales, llevándolos a destinos desconocidos entre los distintos planos de realidad y sus diferentes líneas temporales.

Este juego incorpora al mundo de Experior, no solo la Fantasía Épica Oscura, ya presente en otros juegos de la linea, sino que incluye la Ciencia Ficción desde distintos paradigmas evolutivos, desarrollos telequinéticos, tecnología steampunk, Ciberpunk, mundos de seres todopoderosos, anomalías, mutaciones y aberraciones.

Partiendo de un mazo asimétrico de 10 cartas básicas, cada jugador arrojara dados básicos, podrá usar las cartas en su mano para canjear por mas dados o usar sus habilidades si puede pagarlas o potenciar otras habilidades ya disparadas. Las combinaciones de uso son infinitas y estas dependerán de lo que los dados dicten, pudiendo aparte conseguir nuevas cartas, comprando mejoras o viajar por los portales, llevándolo a destinos inciertos. Ahí podrá pelear o encontrar objetos o mas fisuras que le permitirán seguir viajando.

En modo solitario, el jugador debe cerrar una cantidad de portales, mientras el automa ira restando tiempo de juego. El jugador tiene una vida inicial, si el automa consume el tiempo o la vida del jugador llega a cero, el jugador pierde.
En modo competitivo, será una carrera entre los jugadores por ver quien logra cerrar primero los portales.

—description from the designer (Spanish)

boardgame.name: Anti-Sisyphus ∞
boardgame.description: This issue presents a quote and "15 blank pages where you can write your own antisisyphian thoughts on design"

boardgame.name: Cataria Felicis
boardgame.description:
Witchcraft School for Cats and their Human Familiars

From the introduction:

You are a human.

You live with a cat.

They are a born witch. You are their familiar.

On every cat's first birthday, they receive a letter of invitation from their local witchcraft academy.

User summary:

You need a cat to play this game.

boardgame.name: Karanduun: Make God Bleed (2nd Ed)
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Karanduun is a modern Filipino Epic RPG about worthless heroes dismantling God, whatever cycle of oppression that must be. Inspired by Filipino Folk Epics, novels, komiks, history and high octane shounen anime.

A Tabletop RPG is a game that you play with your friends where you play the roles of characters within fictional settings. Sometimes stories come out of this, sometimes not To play Karanduun, you will need around 3 - 6 players. Read on to learn how to play.

The Tone: The prevailing tone of Karanduun is struggling against oppression while having the strength and abilities of a to-be epic hero, a modern twist on the ancient Filipino Epic. Many kinds of genres can be played using Karanduun: from mystery, action, to drama, to wuxia, to even horror and dread. I advise pulling from many character action video games such as Devil May Cry, Asura’s Wrath, or Bayonetta. For fiction, I advise looking into stuff from the New Weird, along the lines of China Mieville or Jeff Vandermeer, or strange science fantasy like Roger Zelazny and the “Dying Earth” fantasy genre of Jack Vance and Gene Wolfe. For films, films like Akira and Metro Manila inspired the cities, while Heneral Luna and Goyo inspire the settings outside the cities, grimy and stricken with war.

boardgame.name: PicTwist: National Parks Edition
boardgame.description:
Plan, position, and win in this puzzle game of speed and strategy!

In PicTwist: National Park, images of America’s greatest treasures are placed upside down, sideways, and out of order. Put your planning skills to the test with Action Cards to race against other players and reconstruct the natural wonders. Be the first one to fix your park photo to win!

boardgame.name: PicTwist: Bob Ross
PicTwist: Joy of Painting
boardgame.description:
Plan, position, and win in this puzzle game of speed and strategy!

In PicTwist: Bob Ross, the scenic landscapes from The Joy of Painting have been scrambled up, appearing upside down, sideways, and out of order. Put your planning skills to the test with Action Cards to race against other players and reconstruct his works of art. Be the first one to correctly restore your painting to win!

boardgame.name: You are a Very Cozy Dragon
boardgame.description:
A one-person LARP

From the introduction:

You are a dragon. You have no enemies and you have no fears. You are comfortable. You're going to take a nap.
boardgame.rpg: You are a Very Cozy Dragon

boardgame.name: Euro Champions
boardgame.description:
Euro Champions is a card game for 2 to 6 players who have an eye for dominate European football.

In Euro Champions, the tradition and fortune of European clubs will motivate your actions in every round. Your goal is to conquer the most Points Shields. For this players need to make a combination of cards that have enough stars of tradition or fortune to conquer each shield.

In addition, players can also collect cards of clubs from the same country or region and acquire valuable characters to help them or harm their opponents.

And to make everything even more fun and interactive, there's the "Penalty card" that will leave everyone's heart in their mouths!

An exciting and strategic game without being heavy, for 2 to 6 players, to be played with friends, family and find out who is capable of dominating European football!

boardgame.name: Window Pains
boardgame.description:
Window Pains is a light 2-4 player strategy game where you are a craftsmen building a stained glass window, and your opponents are lowly interns messing it up.

Players add cards, partially overlapping the cards already on the table, and score points for the colors connected to rosettes as the play area slowly grows. At the end of the game, score bonus points for your secret objective and tally points to find the winner!

listing.notes: I am the creator of this game. Its portable and easy to learn.

boardgame.name: Das Grosse Autospiel
boardgame.description:
An eventful journey through the 4 seasons. Almost 150 events can influence this trip. Who will manage to get the most points despite all the hurdles?

Players roll dice to move around the board and pick a card from the stack color coded to match the spot they have stopped in. Each card presents a hurdle and assigns points.

The first person to land on the last square by an exact roll of the dice wins.

boardgame.name: Tuhao
boardgame.description:
TuHao is a simple, quick game designed to capture the traditional climbing game experience for two. Tuhao is the Chinese colloquial term for the new class of crass rich folks who have arisen during the past several decades in China.

A game is three hands long. All three hands are dealt to each player at the beginning, but not revealed until each round begins. In each round, the aim is get rid of all your cards first by playing combos. Each time a player “passes” because they are unable or unwilling to play a higher combo, that passing player purloins two cards from the previous played combo to re-use next hand--one card for them and the other for their opponent.

As players start each new round they combine the cards dealt at the beginning with the “tribute” cards chosen or allotted from the previous round. At the end of each round players score for the number of cards left in their opponent’s hand, and at the end of the three rounds the winner is the player with the highest total points.

boardgame.name: Aeronautica Imperialis Fight Command
boardgame.description: Take to the skies! Guide your Imperial Navy or Ork Airwaagh squadron to victory and experience every dive, roll and ultra high-G turn through desperate dogfights in this tactical aerial combat game. Life is the Emperor’s currency, spend it well.
boardgame.videogameexpansion: Aeronautica Imperialis: Flight Command – Skulls Pack

boardgame.name: Battlewake
boardgame.description: Fight for dominion in Battlewake, a fantasy naval combat game built for VR. Play as 4 mythical pirate lords, captain massive battle-ready warships, and summon ancient powers as you set sail on a larger-than-life nautical war for the ages.

boardgame.name: Chipmonk!
boardgame.description: Seek vengeance on the gluttonous gray squirrel in this retro-inspired Beat 'em up starring chipmunk warriors!

boardgame.name: Electronauts
boardgame.description: Immerse yourself in an interactive sonic environment where you build, drop, and jam with your friends and top artists. Remix over 80 tracks and express yourself like never before. Electronauts sets the stage for you to DJ, perform, and make music magic in virtual reality.

boardgame.name: Strategic Command WWII: World At War
boardgame.description: Strategic Command WWII: World At War is your chance to re-fight the 20th century’s greatest conflict, from Poland to China, Normandy to the Pacific, on a map encompassing the globe.

boardgame.name: The Walking Dead Onslaught
boardgame.description: There’s no rest when survival is on the line. Step into AMC’s The Walking Dead and prepare for an onslaught of walkers as you assume the roles of your favourite characters from the show, and confront the horrors and humanity of this apocalyptic new world.

boardgame.name: Wands
boardgame.description: WANDS® is a first-person VR experience that offers fast-paced magic duels against other players online.

boardgame.name: Catan VR
boardgame.description:
Catan VR allows tabletop fans and new players alike to experience the best-selling board game in a fresh, fully-immersive format. Take on other players around the world or play against Catan personalities and watch the island come to life in VR for the first time.

Source - https://www.rotovr.com/experiences/catan-vr

boardgame.name: Synth Riders
boardgame.description: Let the music move you in Synth Riders, a freestyle dance VR rhythm game with official custom song support and a thriving community!

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000: Battle Sister
boardgame.description:
The war-torn world of Warhammer 40,000 brought into jaw-dropping, visceral reality for the first time in VR. Play as an unstoppable Battle Sister, wielding authentic, powerful weaponry and abilities. Be drawn into a gripping, action-filled story against forces of Chaos. The game features a deep and compelling story, spectacular Acts of Faith, slow time and force push abilities, as well as 15 devastating weapons and wargear items, including some fan favourites like Meltas, Flamers, Chainswords and Bolters.

Source - (https://vrgamecritic.com/game/warhammer-40000-battle-sister)

boardgame.name: 零に誠 (Zero Ni Makoto)
boardgame.description:
This game is called Murder Mystery. The player becomes one of the characters in the story and searches for the culprit of the incident that occurs in the story. Since the criminal is also one of the players, the purpose is that the player who became the criminal does not know that he is the criminal.
Each player has his or her own purpose other than searching for the criminal or not knowing it, and each player aims to achieve multiple goals and win the points obtained by achieving them.

"Zero Ni Makoto" is a fictional story about the Edo period in Japan. Do you know the "Shinsengumi" who played an active part as a police in the Edo period? The Shinsengumi had units from No.1 to No.10, and systematically guarded the town of Kyoto. However, there was a "No. 0" that did not remain in history in the Shinsengumi.

"Zero Ni Makoto" is a story of the success and tragedy of Shinsengumi No. 0.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: ロナエナ ―厄災のギフト (Ronaena: Gift of Disaster)
boardgame.description:
This game is called Murder Mystery. The player becomes one of the characters in the story and searches for the culprit of the incident that occurs in the story. Since the criminal is also one of the players, the purpose is that the player who became the criminal does not know that he is the criminal.
Each player has his or her own purpose other than searching for the criminal or not knowing it, and each player aims to achieve multiple goals and win the points obtained by achieving them.

"Ronaena -Gift of Disaster-" is a story about searching for the murderer of the murder case that occurs at the research school facility "Ronaena" in the near future in 2025.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: 消えたパンツと空飛ぶサカナ (Kieta Panstu To Soratobu SAKANA)
boardgame.description:
This game is called Murder Mystery. The player becomes one of the characters in the story and searches for the culprit of the incident that occurs in the story. Since the criminal is also one of the players, the purpose is that the player who became the criminal does not know that he is the criminal.
Each player has his or her own purpose other than searching for the criminal or not knowing it, and each player aims to achieve multiple goals and win the points obtained by achieving them.

"Kieta Pantsu To Soratobu SAKANA -Lost Panties And Fish Fly In The Sky-" is a Murder mystery where five friends living in a share house search for the whereabouts of their lost panties. This story has a shocking impact on everyone.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: 六花と灰色の夢見草 (Ricca To Haiiro No Tsukimisou)
boardgame.description:
This game is called Murder Mystery. The player becomes one of the characters in the story and searches for the culprit of the incident that occurs in the story. Since the criminal is also one of the players, the purpose is that the player who became the criminal does not know that he is the criminal.
Each player has his or her own purpose other than searching for the criminal or not knowing it, and each player aims to achieve multiple goals and win the points obtained by achieving them.

"Ricca To Haiiro No Tsukimisou -Ricca and Gray Cherry Blossoms-" is the first in a series of Murder mystery that seeks out the true criminal by clearing the suspicion of the girl detective "Ricca" who is always the suspect in the case.

Find out the truth about the fall and death of her students in Ricca's high school.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: 六花と日輪草のベーカリー (Ricca To Himawari No Bakery)
boardgame.description:
This game is called Murder Mystery. The player becomes one of the characters in the story and searches for the culprit of the incident that occurs in the story. Since the criminal is also one of the players, the purpose is that the player who became the criminal does not know that he is the criminal.
Each player has his or her own purpose other than searching for the criminal or not knowing it, and each player aims to achieve multiple goals and win the points obtained by achieving them.

"Ricca To Himawari No Bakery -Ricca and Bakery of Sunflower-" is the first in a series of Murder mystery that clears the suspicion of the girl detective "Ricca" who is always the suspect in the case and searches for the true criminal.

We will explore the truth of the owner's death, set in the bakery "Sunflower" where Ricca works.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Una Que Pensamos Todes
boardgame.description:
Naivety and ingenuity are shared.

Una Que Pensamos Todes is a game of associations. A game that proposes to discover the corners of our minds that we share with the rest. Once per round, a person will turn over a card from the Context Deck and a card from the Trigger deck at the same time. Each player will then have one minute to think or write down a concept or idea that associates both cards. After the minute we will see how many people put the same thing as us and that will be our score. After ten rounds, whoever has scored the most points will be the person who wins.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Storm Ground
boardgame.description:
The first strategy videogame adaptation of Age of Sigmar’s dark-fantasy universe. Lead your highly-customisable force, and unlock new units, equipment and skills in this dynamic turn-based game packed with fast-paced warfare.

Source - https://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/warhammer-age-of-sigmar-s...
boardgame.videogameexpansion: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Storm Ground - Spoils of War Weapon Pack

boardgame.name: War on the Horizon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure primer for CAPERS, someone has framed the gang for a crime they didn't commit, find out who did it, stop a gangwar from consuming the city, all before the chance at peace has been blown to smithereens.

boardgame.name: A Thaumaturge
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new playbook for flying circus centered around science, face turns, and the old world. This playbook is centered around learning to understand the world as it is and growing a new world from the ashes.

Or pilfer the ideas there to make your next antagonist!

boardgame.name: Juho
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Somewhere on the Coast of Himmilgard there is a small town, like every town in Himmilgard there is adventure to be had.

This one page town primer is a prompt to get a basic town running if you are having trouble making more, it comes with a 1d10 table of world-building answers and questions as well as three people of interest you can use. If you don't use this town you can still pilfer these ideas.

boardgame.name: Carrion Protocol
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A small spaceship suddenly finds itself in massive trouble. The meat labs are going haywire. There is meat everywhere and it's moving. The meat is aggressive, the meat is lethal. THE MEAT WANTS YOU DEAD

Carrion Protocol is a systemless micro dungeon designed to print on a single piece of paper. The players will explore a small spaceship that had its meat-growing labs start producing fast-growing monsters instead of food.

boardgame.name: Book of Vile Dungeons
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A collection of one-page, one-shot dungeons for your favorite RPG, with Mӧrk Borg compatible stat blocks.

boardgame.name: Knowing Revenge of the Grasping Gods
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Your party has just stolen legendary power from the gods, who are beginning to rise from their eternal slumber. You are now running for your life, and your only way to evade them is to reach the Eternal Flame and burn away your mortality.

Become a deity or die trying. Defy the gods. Become the gods.

A system-agnostic adventure recommended for veteran adventurers.

boardgame.name: The Old Chapel of the Candle Lich
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A low-level adventure where you venture into the the lair of the mad Candle Lich and take a shot every time somebody needs to say "Wax".

boardgame.name: Inflame the Yellow Crown
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A beehive, dormant for generations, is broken into by a band of ambitious bandits looking for a home. The bandits rebrand themselves Buzzkills, and begin terrorizing the locals. However, the Hive isn't the secure fort they thought it was, and they soon find themselves in thrall to an ancient Queen Bee Sorceress, and her resurrection is at hand.

Can brave mouse adventurers stop the ancient queen's resurrection? Will they save the Buzzkills from the queen's hold? Or will they just take the treasure and run?

Inflame the Yellow Crown is a beehive crawl for the Mausritter RPG. It includes:

- A dungeon crawl through the ancient hive-tomb of the sorceress Queen Melys amidst her broods resurrection
- A lightly detailed hex to slot into an ongoing hexcrawl
- 10+ new items, including Melys's legendary sabre, magical restorative honey, and a Soul-trapping Jar
- 2 new bee-themed spells and unique beeswax spell tablets
- A set of 6 hooks to get your players invested

boardgame.name: Better Left Buried
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

An ancient tomb, sealed for centuries, is now open. New dangers lurk in the darkness and a horrible curse plagues a nearby village.

You can use this quick adventure starter for any fantasy TTRPG.
